description: Excellent food here. Hubby and I went for dinner and had tuna poke, cucumber salad, spicy garlic noodles and Korean pork tacos. They were out of the ribs the night we went, which was a bummer because I wanted to try those. However, the pork tacos were amazing due to the flavor on the meat. And I loved the spiciness to the garlic noodles making them a little more interesting than your standard garlic noodles. This is a happening local spot, so get there early before it gets too crowded. Will definitely be back here again. Don't miss the pork tacos!
author: Goldi J.

description:
I love this place- fantastic service, fun atmosphere. Very tasty food!

Key Advice:  make sure you get in on the Korean tacos before they sell out each night!

Everything on the menu is amazing. 

Reservations are not easy but you can come by, put your name in, then leave your # for when the spot opens up.

Come by, ask for Angela and let her order for you!
author: Jason E.

description: I was really impressed with this place. First, it was one of the few places in the marina that was really bustling, and with good reason.  We ordered the papaya salad, chubby fried chicken, garlic noodles and Korean tacos. The tacos were the best, but it was all great. We'll  be back!
author: Robbie C.

description: I love this place. I love the food, the atmosphere and the music. It's a great spot to hang out with friends and the Korean Pork Tacos are out of this world! I also love the short ribs - so good! I just wish the service was a bit better. The waiters are always great but I do often get a very grumpy host. I know it's a busy place and it's a lot to keep on top of things, but it could be a bit friendlier.
author: Samantha H.

description: Came here for dinner, got seated after a 15 minute wait around 7pm on a Saturday which is pretty good because usually there are pretty long lines. Food was good! Loved the Korean tacos - must get. Garlic noodles were not the best I had but okay and flavorful still. Ahi tuna was yummy too but I prefer the Hawaiian poke places personally. Would probably not come again but enjoyed nonetheless!
author: June L.

description:
Had a take-out order of pad Thai, papaya salad, and chicken wings

Pad Thai: I'm not really sure this place knows what Pad Thai is. The flavors were completely off, the noodles were overcooked mush, and there were no vegetables whatsoever. The entire dish was overwhelmed by fishy scent/taste.

Papaya salad: pretty good, crunchy papaya and other veggies. A little scant on the dressing, but otherwise flavor was decent, but not amazing. Was definitely missing lime and spice.

Chicken wings: delicious, well cooked, albeit slightly soggy although this may have been due to the delivery order. Flavors and quantity was good.

Overall, with how highly rated and recommended this place is, was very disappointed with this $50 order. Would not repeat.
author: Michael M.

description: Spicy garlic noodles is the name of the game!!! Very nice place to bring a date.
author: Ash M.

description:
This is one of my favorite, absolute favorite, places to eat in the Marina! I've been here for brunches, dinners, and even held a friends' birthday dinner with 15+ people at this spot (reserved in advance, pre-fix menu, still bomb). And recommend it to everyone and anyone looking for good food and a good atmosphere. 

The service is usually fantastic. The vibe is fun and alive and is the perfect way to start a Friday/Saturday night out with friends. The music is nostalgic hip-hop that puts everyone in a good mood. It's a small space so it fills up quick and stays busy, be ready to wait for a table if you don't have a reservation. Just get some sake at the bar and enjoy the experience. 

Tips- keep the sake flowing, get the Cold Tea, garlic noodles, green beans and definitely don't forget the Kung Pao wings.
author: G R.

description: You definitely need to come to this place hungry. Leave the ordering up to the waiter, he'll sort you out. It's a bit pricey, you definitely won't be able to eat your share of food but you might be able to make it up in terms of drinks. The staff are super friendly and there's an endless chain of food options available.
author: John J.

description: $59 for a bottle of sake that retails for $14.99 tells you everything you need to know about this place.  That is the highest mark up for liquor I have ever seen, anywhere in the world.  Average food that tends to the greasy side doesn't help either. The servers are friendly but can't make up for the food and rip off prices.  Stay away from Chubby Noodle.
author: Bill S.

description:
Casual, Asian Fusion - $$

2 Locations: Marina and North Beach

Best Dishes:
-Chicken Chow Mein
-Fried Rice

Best For: Boozy brunch, casual lunch/dinner

Great brunch deal on the weekend: $37 for all you can eat all you can drink. The food here is really good too. Also their playlist is bomb. (which you can follow on spotify haha)
author: Kelli L.

description:
Chubby Noodle presents a very interesting buffet concept, in which there is a fixed menu, and one chooses items on that menu for a standard price of $37. Included are 4 alcoholic beverage choices, and perhaps a list of 15-20 food choices for only 90 minutes!!

It's "dim sum", but to me, it's just Asian Fusion food. Some of the things that stood out:
Jook: totally asian fusion, with a fried egg, chili oil and some bacon bits. Not bad, but not hot enough. I like my Jook super hot!
Peking duck: Disappointing. super dry, and they did not do a good job cleaning the skin. and to be honest, not really peking duck at all! Real peking duck, you just eat the skin! 
Wings: Over-fried, super dry.
Shrimp Fried Rice: nothing special. I just ate all the shrimp.
Stir fry noodles: I like noodles so this was good, but I wasn't down to pay $37 to just eat noodles and shrimp. 
Shrimp Shanghai Dumplings: Why call them shanghai dumplings, instead of just Shrimp Baos, when there's nothing Shanghainese about them. There is no soup inside the dumpling, and the bread is super thick. I took the filling out and just ate it, but even then didn't really find it delectable. 

Only good thing was the fried shrimp, I could've eaten a whole plate on my own! 

The drinks are also really watered down. And I'm not talking about when the ice melts, before the ice melts, it's already pretty watery. Sangria is really fruity, good for the ladies who don't really want to get all drunk and sloppy, and the strongest would probably be the Cold Tea. And even then, the Cold tea was a mix of some bitterness, and ginseng, and not tasty to me. Cute little ducks with every drink

Super loud and crowded place. You could probably fit 6 in a booth, but it's so cramped. Would not come back because the quality and taste of the food does not meet the price tag. I could get real dim sum for a little less and have leftovers!
author: Sandra L.

description: Had to travel for work and came here on a whim and needless to say only got to look up things near the hotel, however, this came from a local friend on a recommendation and worked out very well. Ordered the pork tacos and normally I'm not a fan of fusion foods but this was a good dish and would not have guessed it to be a fusion. Small and quaint so make reservations if a large group or going during peak times
author: Alex S.

description: Mediocre food at best. Be ready to eat while profanity, stripper this, efff that music is played at a deafening volume. Skip this place, go somewhere else!
author: Food L.

description:
Pro: Good Food

Cons:  VERY Limited Menu

VERY LOUD Music catering to the 20-30 year olds to include vulgar language.  We won't be going back solely based on the businesses choice of music.
author: Mesquite L.

description:
We finally came here for dinner after a year we living in Marina area.
Food is good but doesn't worth 5 stars but I love the ambience and decoration.
We ordered garlic noodle, chicken wings, bok choy and korean pork taco which was the best from all the dishes we ordered.

I would come again for their Dim Sum brunch
author: Ilma D.

description:
This place is so much fun! Bottomless everything for brunch!

Booking of 6 people, two of us were early/on time and we waited at the bar with a drink until the rest of our party arrived. We were having "brunch" which is $37 (before tax and tip) per person and that includes bottomless drinks and all the food you can eat in 90 minutes! But its not brunch in the traditional sense: Asian food! Dumplings, fried rice, salt and pepper shrimp and noodles! But you don't actually order anything - they just start bringing you food, and if you really like something, tell them and that'll bring more of it! One of our party was allergic to fish and eggs, and our server was fantastic at bringing her food that she could eat.

The drinks are so cute - I loved the mimosas and sangria. Each one comes with a tiny rubber duck - remember to save it and see how many you have at the end of your 90minutes! 

The atmosphere is the place is amazing - pretty loud hip hop music so you feel like you're in a club. So knock back the drinks, see how many ducks you can collect and get a good brunch buzz!
author: Kathleen G.

description: Awesome food, awesome service! They started all you can eat and drink for weekend brunch for $35!! Consist of dim sum and non/alcoholic drinks! You have a total of 90 mins. Very worth it!!
author: Jenn L.

description:
The good. 

Porridge - Awesome! Best porridge I've ever had. Who would have thought bacon and egg on porridge could be so delicious. My favorite dish in the entire menu. Add a little bit of hot sauce and it's the best thing in the world. 

Dumplings. - Great! Really flavorful and was surprised that dumplings that weren't really made from a Chinese restaurant would even be on par. Their Shanghai dumplings weren't traditional Chinese dumplings but they were still good. 

Chilled ramen - Good! Mix everything in the bowl and you got a really good chill ramen. The taste was nice and clean and you could taste every ingredient. Noodles were cooked pretty well so they weren't too chewy or soft. 

Pork and shrimp wonton - Great! full flavored and wasn't heavy with the salt like normal dim sum places. Could definitely taste the shrimp and pork. 

Mimosa - Yum. They were giving out cups of mimosas and they were good. Made perfectly so you tasted just a hint of the alcohol. The duck floating in there was fun. 

The Okay. 

Wonton soup - Not bad. Very light flavored and the wontons were juicy but not much flavor to them itself. The bok choy had absolutely no flavor. Maybe the soup was too light. I still liked it however. 

Salt and Pepper shrimp - Not bad. The shrimp was seasoned nicely and the sauce gave it a nice kick. Would order this again but it seemed too plain. 

The not so good

Chubby Chicken Chow Mein - Bad. All I taste is oil and soy sauce. Way too much soy sauce. Totally masked any flavor the dish had and just. soy. sauce. everywhere. 

Hot and sour soup - Weak. It wasn't sour nor hot and it seemed like there was just too much going on in there. Too bland and not enough of the bold sour nor spicy taste. 

Pekin Duck steam bun - Now the taste actually wasn't bad but it's the set up is weird. Usually, the duck is cut in slices so you can just pick up the meat and put it on the bun. This dish, you had to cut it yourself and it was just a mess trying to get the fat off. Could have been better presented. 

Rice cake in XO sauce - This is in between the Okay and bad rankings. I liked it the first time I tried one but after the second and third one, it was just way too sweet. The sweetness overtook the peppers and just left it tasting like soft candy. 

Kung pao chicken wings - These looked better than it tasted. Well, there wasn't much taste to it. It looked spicy and full of flavor but when I bit into it, it was a let down. I love chicken wings so I was pretty disappointed in this dish. 

Overall the place has a great atmosphere and awesome for dinner parties. The staff was all really friendly and quick to bring out the dishes. The food here is pretty good. Some better then others as you can see in my review above. I'd come here again for the porridge alone.
author: Will C.

description:
This is a great little spot tucked in the bustle of Lombard we hit up pretty regularly. The vibe is always fun and bustling with new jams blasting. If you're looking for a quiet dinner this is not the spot, but they churn out some killer asian dishes.

We love:
- Garlic Noodles w/ Pork
- Korean Pork Tacos
- Poke
- Chinese Green Beans

They also have a pretty killer bottomless Dim Sum / Mimosa brunch, which is super popular. Come early and be prepared to wait or grab a drink at the bar.
author: Brian H.

description: Asian fusion people pleasers like garlic noodles, pad thai, egg rolls, etc. Food is definitely on the oily side but the place plays loud music and has a nice atmosphere
author: Mingmei N.

description: The spicy garlic noodles are my favorite! The Green beans are also surprisingly amazing and delicious. The restaurant is on the smaller side, so definitely make a reservation if you can. I went on a Saturday night and it was super loud and pretty rowdy, but would definitely go back. If you have to wait, there's a cute wine bar across the street to grab a drink at.
author: Rachel C.

description: Teach me how to Dougie was on when we walked in and it only went uphill from there. All the art work is on the ceiling.  The plates are small but full of flavor. The wait staff was very polite and fun. The Korean tacos are a must.
author: Erin J.

description: Just hit up their bottomless Dim Sum Brunch today. It was awesome. The duck broth in the Won Ton soup is such a tasty take. The hot and sour soup is also delicious. Customer service was great, and the drinks and food kept flowing. I'll be back very shortly to try everything else I didn't get to on the menu.
author: Aaron O.

description:
My biggest complaint about Chubby Noodle is the confusing logo on the sign outside. First of all, only one of the noodles has a face. It's sort of disturbing. Second of all, that one noodle with the face is very wide (or flat), but definitely not chubby. Third of all, the colors of the sign really clash, and being super lit at night doesn't help at all either. 

All logos aside, I loved the food at Chubby Noodle. I ordered the spicy garlic noodles with fried chicken (you have your choice of meat), Korean pork tacos, BBQ pork fried rice (+ egg), salt & pepper shrimp, and garlic green beans. The pork tacos run out, so be sure to order those if still available. I definitely advise adding an egg if you order the BBQ pork fried rice. Everything tastes better with an egg. The garlic green beans were actually the tastiest of all the dishes with the garlic noodles being a close second. The salt & pepper shrimp were a bit of a miss, but still decent with the provided sauce.

Service was a bit slow as our waiter repeatedly forgot to refill our water. However, he was super helpful in describing each dish and even asked questions about our preferences and reasons for selecting certain dishes in order to give us better recommendations. This location has reservations so it makes it a bit easier to visit, compared to the North Beach location.
author: Daniel S.

description: This was a ok place ... the wings are amazing , the kimchi was alright did not like the fried rice or lemon juice at all. Great service overall ok .
author: Natasha B.

description: The Pad Thai is really good and the place is cool (a bit loud if you are not a fan of hip hop).
author: Charline D.

description:
Let me start off by saying how prestine this place is.

From the customer service, to the beer, to the food-
Everything is TOP NOTCH. 

I'd give them 10 stars if I could! 

Can't wait to come back.
author: Karla B.

description:
Hey : ) 

BBQ Pork Fried Rice  $11
Cucumber Salad  $4
Fried Chicken  $12
Korean Pork Tacos $11
Pork Ribs $15

Chubby Noodle has AMAZING fried chicken. The chicken comes in thick, moist cube pieces. The dipping sauce is to die for! However, ask for EXTRA sauce. They give you one small container of sauce with 30 piece of chicken. Come on, really??!!! The sauce is what sets off your taste buds! The container should be bigger to accommodate the amount of chicken given. Overall, this dish isn't to be missed. You will be in heaven with every bite! 

The BBQ Pork Fried Rice is tasty. The pork is marinated to PERFECTION! What more to say, the rice is always a winner!

Cucumber Salad a must. Just cucumbers in rice vinegar with sesame seeds. You can't go wrong.

The Korean Pork Tacos were extremely greasy. The tortilla shells are drenched with oil. Almost too greasy to hold. Mostly importantly, too greasy and oily to eat. The pork is mediocre. It's flavorless and dry. I would have preferred the bbq pork used in the fried rice.The yogurt chilli sauce is pretty good. Nice flavor and texture. The best part of the dish. Definitely wouldn't buy the tacos again.

The Pork Ribs are EXTREMELY SALTY! The ribs are marinated in vinegar soy glaze. It sounds delicious on the menu, however, it taste horrible. Your given three ribs. MOSTLY BONE. Which isn't enough for the 15 dollar price tag. The soy flavor is overpowering and pugent which distracts you from enjoying the meal. I would suggest adding brown sugar to offset and compliment the salty element. I would never ever buy these ribs again. Complete waste of money!  

The atmosphere is pretty laid back. They have music playing in the background. Great playlist! However the music is so loud, you find yourself yelling. Not cool! The employees are always welcoming and friendly. A plus! No one like to spend money at an establishment that doesn't recognize them once they walk in the door!

The restrooms need to be cleaned on more of a consistent basis. The restrooms are unisex. With that being said, it frustrating going to a  restaurant with good food but horrible restrooms. They need to attend to the restrooms every 2 hours. If a restaurant has a nasty restroom it pretty much determines if I will come back. Please work on the janitorial aspect of the restaurant. I strongly urge that! 

Overall, good experience. I would come back. Forgot to mention, ordered food in December 2016. I've only ordered take-out. Phone orders take about 20 - 25 mins. Pretty curious about there dine-in service. 

P.S. This is my first review! Hope it was detailed and informative. Toodles my Noodles : )
author: Audrey J.

description: Vegetarian's nightmare. Not that most ppl care, but Jesus Christ. Nothing on the menu and not accommodating whatsoever. Completely messed up the order. Ever had pad Thai with Soy? Never had I. Don't.
author: Sam O.

description: Was craving noodles one night. So i yelped noodles. This popped up. We hopped into the car and was there in 10 minutes. No wait for line. Yes! And then got the menu...no noodles on the menu that night... Wtf... How are you called chubby noodle if you don't have any noodles... The menu posted was not the menu online. What a disappointment. And now can't get the s.o. to try the other location cause he felt lied to...soo dramatic but true... :( the food was good just not any noodles which is what I would expect from Chubby NOODLES!!! We ended up just eating there cause it was 9 and we weren't close to anything else that was open at that time...
author: Fanny C.

description: I've only done takeout from here, but the food is consistently good. The buttermilk chicken bites are fantastic, as are the noodles with fried chicken and Korean tacos. Solid go to when I'm hungry and don't want to be disappointed.
author: Matthew v.

description: Chubby Noodle was probably the greatest combination of Asian and American cuisine I've ever seen. The atmosphere provided the customer with the calm aura one would suspect when dining at an Asian restaurant. The cherry on top was the rap music that plays as you enjoy a delicious bowl of spicy garlic noodles.
author: Katie F.

description:
DE-LI-CIOUS.
Food: 5 Stars
Service: 5 Stars

Was not really sure what to expect from Chubby Noodle but boy was I impressed! Upon walking in, I was a little annoyed to be told I had to wait for my party to arrive when half the restaurant was wide open, but ok. Once we finally got seated, service was super attentive and friendly. But most importantly, food was AWESOME.

We got the pork fried rice (A+), the pork tacos (oH MY), the chinese green beans (YOU'RE KIDDING ME), and the tuna poke (pretty dang good). It's rare to love EVERY item you order, especially when it's your first time and you're kinda ordering blindly, but boy did Chubby Noodz bring it. I seriously would go back every night this week.

Just be aware, it's a super small place so you may have a wait! But it's totally worth it.
author: Rachel L.

description:
3.5 stars really. 
First off, I want to mention that this was my first time in San Francisco. I'm from New York and had no clue where the good spots are. I found out about this place while checking in to the hotel- some guy checking out said to go here which was right down the block. So we did!

Once we got there we got our drinks and everything all good. The waitress said that its family style. Not quite. Well, coming from NY family style to us is massive plates so i don't know about California family style.. She recommended ordering 5-6 different things on the menu but we  got 4 and it was plenty (for 2). 
Everything was very good. The pork/shrimp wontons were a tad toooo spicy for my liking and the pork tacos, which were delicious, only came as 2 tacos (clearly not family style).

Overall, food and service was very good. Its an asian type of place that plays early 2000s hip hop but a good spot to come with friends more than family with young kids!
author: Nikki L.

description:
Super tasty Asian Fusion which pairs well with their drink selection~Pushback Wine or Cold Tea, maybe a cold beer?!?!
While it's a happing new place in the Marina you see quite the eclectic mix, mingling, dancing to the 90s hip hop and chewing! :)
My favs~menu often changes are the garlic noodles, wings and the kimchi~awesome! Poke' should not be missed! 
The cozy eatery has huge windows which over look Lombard and allow people to see you have the Best time with Tasty Food!
Pete and Nick~I don't go to the Marina but when I do it's for Chubby Noodle! ;)
author: yvette c.

description:
Lets start off with the place is small, came here for the all you can eat brunch on a Saturday and it was pretty tight. We had a group of 9 and it was a squeeze since the table was small and they had to add a chair at the end to fit nine. Just keep in mind you will be bumping elbow but you'll get over after a couple of drinks. I believe it was $37 + tax + tip for 90 mins of endless food and drinks, the place is hip and attracts the younger group. You can choose from 4 different drinks and the options for food here are just plain awesome.
Breakfast Jook
Hot and Soup Soup
Wonton Soup
Chilled Ramen
Chow Mein
Shrimp Dumplings
Chicken Dumplings
Orange Salad
Shanghai Dumplings
Peking Duck
Salt and Pepper Shrimp
Kong Pao Chicken Wings
Green Beans
Bok Choy
Missing an item or two but our favorites were the Breakfast Jook, Orange Salad, Salt and Pepper Shrimp, and Duck! This place is for sure one of a kind and super fun but beware of eating too much!! I didnt eat for a whole 24 hours after having the bottomless brunch and thought I was goign to explode!
author: Eileen H.

description:
Chubby Noodle is not a bad restaurant. The food is good, but definitely nothing exciting. It is overpriced for sure, and that is primarily the drinks are overpriced. Like $10-$14 a drink. The food was pretty standard pricing but I think smaller portions.  This place got two stars because the food was good, but if it wasn't it would have gotten one star because of its price and the bro-ish marina atmosphere.

We ordered:
Garlic Noodles
Papaya Salad
Pork Ribs 
Sapporo
Weather (Pinot Noir)
Sake Bombs

Total=$80

Garlic Noodles: These were good! Not to oily and I liked that the noodles were thick and had a nice texture. Good amount of garlic too. Small portion. 

Papaya Salad: You can never go wrong with papaya salad. It was crispy and refreshing! Decent size. 

Pork Ribs: These were really tasty! Fall of the bone soft and packed with flavor. Just the right amount of stickiness. You get about 8-10 pieces. 

Atmosphere: Great music! 90s hip-hop. The place was packed with Marina bros.  If that is your thing, go for it! Definitely not my jam. 

I doubt I will go back unless desperate for the yummy ribs.
author: N S.

description:
2.5 Rounded up. 

This review is for the AYCE dim sum. I think that the concept is cool, but ultimately it falls short from the hype that is created by the cool concept. In general, dim sum is cheap enough to eat to your heart's content for less than the AYCE price offered by Chubby Noodle ($37). While the food was good, it was also not very memorable.  The variety of food and cost of food don't live up to the hype. They also don't have non-alcholic beverages other than water.

I do think the quality of the food is good, the service was awesome, and I was satisfied. I think it's good if you're not an adventurous eater and want to try dim sum. Unlike the usual dim sum places that kind of expect you to know what to eat and where service is generally not a priority, this place will help you order some high quality basic dim sum staples.
author: Ariana V.

description: One of my colleagues referred me to this place, they have spicy garlic noodle with fried chicken and it tastes really good. I have gone there twice for the same thing. It's worth it
author: Sankha S P.

description: While it might be a bit of the marina crowd, this place was friendly and delicious! The tacos were incredible and other dishes were all solidly delectable. Definitely a restaurant where the food itself is worth the visit.
author: J K.

description: I'm not a food critic but I know what spicy garlic noodle is supposed to taste like. Their signature dish should be call Greasy noodle instead of spicy garlic noodle cuz I didn't taste any garlic nor spiciness in the stuff. That fried chicken was not fried, it was pan fried (strangely with the texture of overcooked salmon). It was not seasoned right, lacking in flavor. I would give this place one star but for their ambience, music, decoration and vibe; they earned an extra star. A good place to show off but the food is nothing extraordinary.
author: Mei L.

description:
This place is amazeballs

Incredible taste and ambience :)

Best wings ever; donot miss the lettuce and duck
Great place
author: Dharm S.

description: We found a parking space on Steiner and Lombard planning on IHOP and were intrigued by what we saw in chubby noodle. We were seated then it was Duck! Salt n peppa shrimp! Sweet chili wings! It was trendy western dim sum at its best. Price fix at $37 per person includes drinks. Freaking delicious and totally worth the treat. They need to turn down the music tho'
author: gabriella m.

description: Great place to take a date for more casual dining. The mood is high energy and fun with tight seating - not so good for quiet conversation. Young hip clientele and vibe with attentive service. The Garlic noodles and Korean tacos were pretty good.
author: Ann C.

description: One of my FAVORITE brunch spots in the city. Have been going here for years for the AYCE brunch. Great loud music and delicious food. Service is responsive and friendly too! My bf and I bring our out of town friends here to show them a good time. I like sitting in the booths but the last time we sat at the bar, we got countless free sake. This place knows how to treat their customers!
author: Louise C.

description:
Very loud music, crowded , long wait with 3 empty tables , they forgot one of our dishes , but the food was good .
Sat. Night 9 p.m.
author: Rick W.

description: Huge shout out to the man Sebastian for making sure our drinks never ran empty. Chubby Noodle es fuego.
author: David H.

description:
I was so pleasantly surprised by brunch at this place last weekend. My mom was in town visiting and I wanted to take her to the one in north beach because I LOVE the spicy garlic noodles, but they weren't opened for lunch on Sunday. We walked into the marina location instead and I was shocked by how many people were raging for brunch! 

Without going into too much detail, I was not disappointed in food or service once we decided to stay and eat. Everything we ate was delicious, drinks were awesome (and glasses never empty), and all the staff knew what they were doing and were really on top of their sh*t. 

Seriously amazing experience, thanks chubby noodle team!
author: Anna K.

description:
This place has a cool atmosphere, aside from the blasting loud music. The staff is attentive and friendly. However, the food was unimpressive. 

We tried the garlic noodles with prawns. These "prawns" were nothing more than frozen shrimp that retained their oceany flavor and did little for the noodles in terms of taste. There also weren't that many for $5 extra. The noodles themselves weren't bad, but they weren't anything special.

We also tried the bbq pork fried rice which had more meat than the noodles, but the meat itself was dry and not very flavorful. The fried rice was ok as well, like the noodles. 

Overall, I would not return because the quality of food for the price is not worth it and the music is way too loud to have a conversation with anyone while dining.
author: C K.

description:
To get the superficial out of the way - easily the best music of any restaurant I've ate in in the last year.  Perfect mix of classic and new hip hop. 

I'm vegan, which they'll accommodate with a rice dish and some sautéed vegetables and it's downright delicious.  My friends rave about everything else on their menu. 

Enjoy!
author: Joe C.

description: Excellent food, service, and ambiance.  They played an entire Drake album, "Views from the 6".  Enough said.  Great place to take a date or a group of friends.
author: Jason W.

description:
Ok.. I'm not sure where I've been, but this place is awesome. Went with a friend for dinner a few weeks ago and loved every single thing we ordered.

- TUNA POKE 
- SPICY GARLIC NOODLES
- CHINESE CHICKEN SALAD
- SALT & PEPPER PRAWNS 

Plates are decent sized, but definitely small enough to share and order multiple. I suggest making a reservation or simply grabbing a glass of wine/beer from the selection they have on draft at the bar up front. We shared the house sake during our meal, which paired nicely too. My only compliant would be that the space is small and super crowded, so I kept getting hit by people walking by. It's also super, super loud (not a great environment to have a serious conversation), but they're bumping 90s rap so who can be made about that?? Can't wait to come back!
author: Lauren C.

description: LOVE Chubby Noodle! They have amazing food and the music is always on point (you can get the playlist on Spotify). The Tuna Poke is my favorite! The Korean Pork Tacos cannot be beat. Definitely recommend this place! I hear the brunches are great too.
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
Great place with a very communal atmosphere. Seating is very close together since the place is pretty tiny, but you'll forget about that when the food gets to the table. 

Because the kitchen is small, they bring out dishes as soon as they're ready. 

Going with a party of 2-4 is best. No more or else you may not get a table, but do go in a group as everything is meant to be shared. 

Chubby Chicken - a 10x time better version of Chicfila's chicken nuggets with spicy mayo sauce! These are made with buttermilk and you can definitely taste the difference. 

Spicy Garlic Noodles - decent, could be spicier but still very good if you're craving noodles. 

Salmon Sashimi - the salmon is so fresh and each piece is pretty big! 

Korean Pork Tacos - MUST GET! These were my favorite - I'm not usually a pork person, but the prok was marinated just right. Lots of flavor! 

4/5 because the place was a little loud in my opinion, but everyone should go check it out.
author: Bhumi P.

description: Came here unannounced on a potentially busy Wednesday night. Right off the bat, the hostesses were attentive and sweet, then the waiter was awesome and helpful with our first-timer syndrome; even the drink runner was super nice. They were playin our favorite hip-hop jams so naturally we enjoyed the ambiance, not to mention how they redesigned the place. It used to be a (ghost-town) Thai restaurant for years...never understood how it could manage such prime real-estate?! Last but not least, all of the food is Amazing. If the ribs haven't sold out, order them now- they're not to be missed.
author: erin d.

description: We went on a Sunday for the first time and found out it was bottomless brunch. We sat at the bar and Steven served us food and drinks. We had the best time!! Steven was great to talk to and the food was excellent. Make a reservation! All around awesome atmosphere here
author: Leah S.

description: Pretty interesting fare. Was on vacation and went to Chubby Noodle when our original pick was closed. Went as a group of four and decided to try some of everything on the menu. We started with the Korean pork tacos which come in a pair, these were great, the sauce they come with is HOT. We then tried the chubby chicken noodles, salt and pepper prawns, pork ribs, and bbq fried rice. If I had to pick anything that I wouldn't order again it'd be the rice. It was good just not great. Overall speedy food delivery, friendly waitress, but their choice in music is a little odd for the atmosphere (think 90s/early 2000s hip hop and rap including Biggie and Ja Rule).
author: Mariah B.

description:
Ordered food through Caviar and got the wrong items, could not reach Caviar so reached to the restaurant, the manager Jackie that was working was SO helpful, called Caviar and got everything sorted so quickly, she really went above and beyond- most restaurants would ask me to deal with caviar (who was closed).
and the food was yummy! Love the garlic noodles
author: Haley H.

description:
Wow! Ate here last night with another couple and I was blown away! The food was delicious and the service was excellent. My top recommendations:

Spicy garlic noodles
Tuna Poke
Salt and pepper prawns
Korean pork tacos
Pork ribs - Absurdly delicious!!!!

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because I couldn't read the drink-side of the menu. I'd say it was set in about 6 or 7 point type and even though I had my glasses on, I sill couldn't read it in the dim lighting.

Note to all restaurant owners, managers and menu designers:
It's hard to read tiny print in dim lighting. Please think about your menu's legibility.
author: John D.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday brunch and had tons of fun with the AYCE&DRINK option!
Bring on the mimosas and sangrias with rubber duckies swimming in it!
FOOD is decent but can be better! It can be less greasy if possible.
Very FUN environment with a big group.
Other than that would likely come back :D
author: Virginia L.

description: The food was GREAT!!!  Having the staff hangout at the bar before the shift; horrible. Punk kids cussing at each other the whole time they waited to clock in for their shift was not cool either. Overheard the bartender tell one of the punk kids to F-off. Music was ghetto rap that  was laced with profanities. Not very impressed this time with the atmosphere. Like I said before the food was great. I highly recommend it. However don't bring the kids.
author: Dave C.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. Go for brunch!! They have all you can eat dishes and drinks for 2 hours. You'll be wowed at how yummy every dish is and leave super satisfied and buzzed at the end:)

My favorite thing about this place though is how fun it is! Every drink comes w a tiny rubber ducky to help you keep track of how many drinks you've had lol and you can keep them as a souvenir 

TIP: perfect group size would be 4 to share all the dishes, but they have tables to fit up to 8 comfortably
author: Cheri K.

description:
So I'm in town on business staying down the street in a Hotel. I walked out to find sustenance and walked by Chubby Noodles but didn't go in. It was loud and I assumed it was a new popular spot that was over priced. Needless to say I stopped at the corner and checked social media. I moved on to a Pizza spot for dinner. 

After dinner as I walked past the loud Chubby Noodles, I couldn't help but stop in for a pint. As the night wore on sitting at the casual bar hanging out with locals, I ended up sitting for several pints, local specialty drinks and house Sake. BTW the house Sake was very smooth. A little too smooth;). I ended up getting the Kunk Pow Wings---- A M A Z I N G !!!!  

Ashley was a delight as was Alex. Werd.
author: Travis M.

description:
Went here last night for the first time with my boyfriend after hearing rave reviews from plenty of my friends and I loved it.  The food was super yummy and I liked their wine selection as well.  I really liked the hip hop music playing and the vibe.  I will say its a little pricey for the amount of food you get and you gotta be in the mood for a more funky scene when you go into dine but i was pleasantly suprised at how yummy all the food was.  I will be going back for sure!

I recommend the korean tacos and the chicken chow mein!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Ducked in for a quick meal.
Ordered the Korean Taco, prawn noodles and steamed Bok Choy which came out within 15min.
Service was helpful with suggestions and very friendly. Walked out having enjoyed a quick tasty meal, nice atmosphere and a bill of only $35
author: Sam M.

description: Some of the best tuna poke I have ever had. I have tried 5-6 other things on the menu and always go back to the tacos, fried rice and dumplings. Love it!
author: Paul K.

description:
The garlic noodles are amazing.  I also enjoyed the hearty portion of ribs.  The duck lettuce cups were okay.  I wish the duck was more crunchy like Chinese style, but it was more like pulled pork.

This is mostly a 20-something crowd, but there are a few 30s, and 40s here. The noise level is high and it gets very crowded after 7pm.   I tell my honey, who cares about the conversation, just read my lips!  What sets this place apart - the spices and sauces make the flavors better than average.

Chubby noodles serves entrees family style and it's mostly small plates.  It is most similar to Betelnut on Union St., except more casual.  It's on the more expensive side as dinner for 2 is about $70.
author: Van N.

description: Food was really good but restaurant was super smoky from the cooking Made it uncomfortable to breath. Needs better ventilation.
author: Suzanne F.

description:
Not too bad food especially the garlic noodles. However, considering that we are in SF, and for the price, there are many other better place. There were 3 of us and we got 3 noodles and the tacos as starter. I have 1 drink. The check came to $85 before tip. 

It's a pretty touristy location so may be they cater to tourists. It has "clubby" feel to the place which is a little weird on Fri at 5:30 pm.

We would not return unless we are in the neighborhood and are desperate.
author: Tracy L.

description:
Holy moly - not sure why I waited so long to try this place. I live in the hood and will be returning often. 

Garlic noodles were on point and a good side to combo with any of their other dishes. Every bite of the entrees were coupled with a slurp of the noodles.

Pork tacos, however, were the start of the show. Seriously delicious - pork was juicy and flavorful and tortilla was gently fried. Drenched in a semi-spicy sauce, two were not enough. Will be getting these again and again and again. 

Bok choy was good, not great.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Moderately enjoyable dishes but I won't be back because it's pretty forgettable and it's a bit loud for conversation.  

Tuna Poke $13 - size was average but the dressing was too salty and masked the great tuna flavor.  It could have been much better if they used a lighter hand, but that's easy to fix.  It did come out very quickly.

Garlic Noodles - though I was looking forward to to this dish the most there wasn't enough garlic or seasoning for me.  

Peking Duck Wraps - this one I had a real problem with because they called it "Peking Duck" but there was no crispy skin, The name is misleading when it's lacking the main component.  That alone was disappointing enough but the duck was completely dry from being over cooked.  Traditionally it's served with scallion, cucumber and sweet bean sauce or pickled radish and hoisin-based sauce.  They did a vietnamese twist here pairing it with pickled radish, carrots and sweet fish sauce.  There was a decent amount of duck.

Music was as loud as many of the reviews mentioned, needed to be turned down a tad.

$40 for 3 items, pre-tip, no drinks, for 2 girls.  Plenty of open tables at 7:15 PM on a Friday night but it got crowded within 30 minutes.
author: Audrey N.

description: This place has significantly deteriorated these days - from food quality to service. I've been coming here for a while and see it first hand. It's definitely lost its edge. That's too bad.
author: Perry T.

description: Today I came to chubby noodle. It was the greatest experience of my life. The food is amazing, and the staff are very attentative. Jaclyn is the owner and she is an amazing young woman! Hospitality at its finest. Thanks you for the experience. It will never be forgotten.
author: Mahir P.

description: DELICIOUS! Friendly ambience & fun environment to hang out & enjoy great food. Played hip music & dimmed lighting. We ordered the papaya salad, garlic noodles w/ fried chicken & the chicken chow mein. My favorite item was the garlic noodles w/ fried chicken - the chicken was very lightly breaded & the noodles were thick with a yummy garlic sauce with enough spice for just a small kick. The papaya salad was good - clean & good portioned. Definitely mix the sauce in with the green papaya before eating.
author: Kristie L.

description: What a fun spot!  Came here with a g/f for brunch on a Sat and left feeling full and a little buzzed.  I love the concept of all you can eat, with drinks but with a time limit.  We even witnessed a group who was given a delicate hint to leave.  One would think that the food wouldn't be up to par at an all-you-can-eat, but everything we ate was very tasty and well prepared.  Clean, fast and not greasy.  I would highly recommended the salt and pepper shrimp, pork buns and chilled ramen and try out all of their drinks!  You do feel like you are in a club, since the music is loud and the place is tiny, therefore, lots of bumping into ppl and feeling a bit uncomfortably warm and with poor ventilation but overall, a fun place to enjoy!
author: Sheri H.

description:
The food is good, but I wouldn't crave anything from here. 

I ate: (ranked from best)
-Pork belly tacos
-Garlic noodles
-Papaya salad
-Chicken wings

The goods:
-Walking distance from my house
-Rap music (early-mid 2000's), which has a special spot in my heart, but calls for a very interesting atmosphere
-Everything is the perfect on the spicy scale.  This sensation is very similar to eating hot cheetos, where you're not yet dying and the spice is just enough to make you want another bite.

The not so goods:
-Everything is super salty.  You will end up chugging water all night. There are several places where this happens, so this isn't a deal breaker, just not ideal.
-You will smell like Chubby Noodle for the rest of the night
author: Laura E.

description: As for the food itself, its mediocre Asian fusion. The Peking duck was tough and extremely dry. I wouldn't recommend this for bona fide Asian food. If anything, the only hightlight was the drinks during brunch. The drinks were average but made the experience worth it. Morever, the day we came the pinpad was unresponsive so we waited a while to pay the check. This was an experience you can live without for the cost, but go for it if you like americanized Asian food.
author: Aleex J.

description:
I went here on a busy Friday night around 8pm with two other people. We were seated much faster than expected and had amazing service from Cameron. 

Our beers were at our table almost immediately after ordering, and our food came out as it was ready. That wasn't an issue though because everything is family style. We ordered four dishes to share amongst the three of us: chicken chow mein, BBQ pork fried rice, Tuna Poke, and the off menu fried chicken. 

The fried chicken and dipping sauce were amazing; I would go back just to have that. The poke and chow mein are also on my must have list. We were not fans of the fried rice though, it was very sweet and not anything I would order again. 

I'm looking forward to trying the garlic noodles next time I go which will likely be very soon. This location is easy walking distance to most marina bars and not as expensive as many options in the neighborhood. Highly recommend!
author: Rebecca G.

description: Delicious late night dining spot with all the old school hiphop hits. It's fun for a date night, sake & beers. It reminds me of someplace in NYC , quick service even when the place is jammed. Love the garlic noodles & authentic long green beans :) it's greasy good
author: Afi A.

description:
What Chubby Noodle lacks in food, it more than makes up for in ambiance...if the ambiance they're aiming for is a rowdy college bar with decent bar food. Fail if they wanted to be anything else.

Service was good, though I'm confused why we had to wait (not for too long) when there were open tables. We grabbed drinks while I wondered, but the music was loud enough to stamp out my thoughts. With music that loud you'd assume they'd have a full bar, and no, you won't think it's loud if you're a lush and used to screaming to have a conversation. Wasn't Chris Brown on an alcohol fueled rage when committing his crimes? If your entire playlist is Chris Brown's hits (ba dap ch), you might as well round out honoring his doucheness by having a liquor license. 

I digress. The spicy garlic noodles were indeed garlicky and really only spicy if you bit into a jalapeño. Yummy! But I couldn't help but think for the same $10 I could've had 10x as much if I just went to an Asian grocery, bought ramen, and added garlic and jalapeños.

The Korean tacos didn't taste Korean at all. The kimchi was more sweet than spicy. I've had much, much better wings (they were flavorful, but too soggy for my liking). The one cocktail they offer (Cold Tea) was reminiscent of a bad home remedy my mom would make me drink and make my throat burn if I was sick.

Do not go here with a date expecting to have a conversation, unless you're used to leaning into each other's faces and screaming. Do come here with a big group of your most obnoxious friends to down sake shots and pound Asian beers. Do not come here expecting fine dining. Do come here if you're tipsy and need carbs to sober you up.
author: Michele P.

description: Had the tonkatsu ramen and it was a poor excuse for ramen. The broth had absolutely no flavor. Also, maybe don't play hip hop music extremely loud. Youre a restaurant, not a night club.
author: Chris C.

description:
Came by Chubby Noddle after an afternoon romping around the Presidio. Upon entering we were attended to by the person behind their bar. We were initially seated there as there weren't any tables. Once one of the tables got freed up we relocated.

We ended up ordering the Chilled Ramen Noodles, Green Beans and Bbq Pork Fried Rice. My friends seemed to have enjoyed the Green Beans and Ramen. I woofed down the Bbq Pork Fried Rice and managed to get half of it all over the table. (I can't really think of why that happened - I digress..)

Overall great service. Food was good but nothing mind blowing.
author: Jared W.

description: Visiting from Florida and came in for a late lunch. Great service and meal. Spicy garlic noodles with chicken, dumplings and pork tacos were especially delicious.
author: Sarah T.

description: Love this place! Ive been many times! 90s hip hop playing and the noodles are awesome.
author: Liza S.

description:
Food: 8/10
 The food here is pretty good. We got the String Beans, pork buns, garlic noodles, and salmon sashimi. The String Beans were amazing. The sauce they used had good amount of flavor, mixed well with the string bean's crunch to create a good multi-dimensional dish. The garlic noodles were also good. This is very similar to the noodles you'd get in a Cantonese banquet style restaurant (usually served with lobster) but not as heavy as the lobster noodles. The pork bun however, wasn't as amazing. I wasn't overly wowed by it and if I came back, I'd probably not get that again. The sashimi had a very unique flavor profile to it. They had an avocado puree/cream on it and when it mixed with the fish, it created this flavor profile that closely resembles yogurt drink (the korean/japanese/asian kind that you'd find in Asian supermarkets) and that was very off putting. I personally don't like it but other members of my party did.
Service: 7/10
 The service here is pretty standard, nothing special. It was a Thursday night in SF and they managed to seat us fairly quickly. Their servers knew what they were talking about and were pretty attentive. Nothing bad to say about the service here.
Overall: 8/10
Additional Notes: This place has good food and a great atmosphere. What's amazing about it was the music they were playing. They played 2000s musics but not too loud (like in clubs/bars) that you can't have a decent conversation, but just enough to get you wanting to start moving. My friend was || this close to getting up and start dancing. I'd definitely come back here next time I'm in SF.
author: Derrick F.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch (6/7/15).

Pros
- great service 

Cons
- food was excessively salty and the quality of the food wasn't worth it
- price (perhaps it would have been better if I had drinks as well, but daytime alcohol consumption is my thing)

If youre looking for quality Chinese food for brunch, I would go to a different restaurant.
author: Josh W.

description:
The clear highlight dish here was the tacos, which I would return for. The won tons and the salad we had were pretty good, and the chow mein was just OK.

It was recommended to us by our waitress to have 3-4 dishes to share between the 2 of us, and in the end, we were both still hungry.

Not a fan of the blasting old school rap thing they had going on.
author: Captain B.

description: This place is bomb. Came here once and have been coming at least once a week the last month. Spicy garlic noodles are a must. Along with the fried chicken and garlic green beans. Wait isn't too long. Food comes quick. In and out in about 30-45 mins. Worth it !
author: Seven R.

description: Everything is awesome. Granted, I've either showed up or left a bit drunk, but the food is legit. Always tend to over order because it's delicious. Get the Korean tacos!
author: Joshua G.

description:
Food-amazing
Service-sucks

My friend and I were having a fun couple hours drinking and eating and gossiping and the night night was going so well until towards the end. I just just finished my last bite and still had a little bit of sake in my glass when a hostess came and told us that "we had been there a while too long and that people are waiting to be seated and we need to finish our dinner ASAP" 

I have never even been asked to leave, even at somewhere like Denny's, and was so irritated and disrespected as a loyal customer. When I confronted another hostess he played clueless like he had no ideas. 

I never give them my service again.
author: Sweeny H.

description:
I just threw up for 12 hours straight because of my dinner at Chubby Noodle last night. This one star review is strictly for the rude server, and the inability for Chubby Noodle to accommodate my food allergy and take it seriously. I was treated as a nuisance instead of a paying customer. Not only that but they told me they would accommodate my allergy and didn't, so I got extremely ill.

When we ordered, I told our server that I have a severe allergy to wheat and products that contain gluten. She literally said this: "Nothing on the menu is gluten free and we don't do any substitutions. Do you even know what gluten is? No one does. Didn't you see that Jimmy Kimmel skit?"

Two things about this statement:
1- NOTHING on menu is gluten free? Fine. I understand if your chef doesn't want to undermine the integrity of his food with substitutions, but when it comes to your customers' health, I would think they would be willing to make a compromise.  
2- The Jimmy Kimmel skit she is talking about it actually completely hilarious. He asks random gluten-free people what gluten is and they have no idea. However, i DO know what gluten is. I spent thousands of dollars in medial research and endoscopies earlier this year to figure out what was wrong with my stomach. I was finally diagnosed with a severe gluten allergy. So this is not a joke as this woman clearly thinks.

Since I couldn't eat anything at Chubby Noodle, our table was going to finish our drinks and leave. Then the hostess (who may also be a manager or owner?) came over and assured me that they could make a flounder dish for me without the soy sauce (which contains wheat) and the flour they typically use. 

So we stayed and the atmosphere is really fun! They were playing great music like Juvenile's Back Yo Ass Up (the original twerk). The food is also pretty good. I could only eat the "special" flounder, but I definitely liked it.

Fast forward to 3 am. I got SO SICK all night and then all day today. This is what typically happens when I eat gluten, so I know that whoever put my order in did not tell the chef to make it gluten free. Its really disappointing and upsetting that a restaurant would be so adverse to accommodating people with allergies. If I was allergic to peanuts would you have still put peanuts in the dish?? Its so rude to treat people like they're lying and that I *wouldn't notice* if some gluten was put into my dish. 

My whole day was shot. Had to call in sick to work. Totally, never ever in 1 million years going back to Chubby Noodle. They should learn to treat people with more respect.
author: Rachael G.

description:
So good, I'm hesitant to review in fear of my favorite local spot becoming overwhelmed w/tons of yelpers edging me out of a seat.

Really great stuff here. The staff is friendly, too. Highlights include:

Salt and pepper prawns
Cambodian beef
Korean tacos

You will put them out of business if you only order those high-overhead meals, however.

Buy a few chicken chow meins and keep my tummy happy (by keeping them in the black)

Cold tea is a different spicy concoction that comes in neat Japanese mugs and must be tried.
author: Dave M.

description: I've only had dim sum once before this experience, so I had no idea what I was in for. My last experience was in a banquet hall of some sort with a fury of people rushing around with carts. So I just expected more of the same. Surprisingly it was the best experience I've had at a restaurant to date. From the moment I walked in I felt welcomed and that made me excited to be there. Plus the food was amazing, 90 minutes of unlimited food items, sign me up!
author: David S.

description: You will dream and tears will come to your eyes when you remember Chubby Noodle's chicken chow mien and green beans. If only I could have one in my backyard.
author: Jacqueline J.

description:
I visited this place three times during my birthday week and had a fantastic time. I sat at the bar and even though it was right near the entrance the ambiance (old school hip hop made me want to shake my booty on the dance floor) and people made each visit incredibly entertaining. Brian the bartender was awesome, no matter how busy it got, he remained super personable. 

The first time I visited I walked right past the place, so be aware it's a bit easy to miss but once you find it you'll be glad you did. I had the chilled ramen noodles, salt and pepper prawns, the pork chop and tuna poke. I was battling allergies one of the evenings so I enjoyed the "cold tea" and it immediately brought me back to life. 

The chilled ramen noodles were topped with a fried egg and after a night of draining all of the bars in the marina of their vodka, this dish hit the spot. The perfectly cooked prawns come with three different dipping sauces so good I wanted to lick each  ramekin clean when I was done. I CANNOT say ENOUGH about the Pork Chop, it is HUGE and not for one afraid of their meat ;) I, for one, can handle a nice juicy thick cut of pork, also comes with kimchi, the added spice makes it very nice.

Also, under the bar where the hooks to hang your purse are is a row of electrical outlets. Genius idea. 

Can't wait to be back!
author: Leslie P.

description: Went for brunch this past weekend. Delicious meal and really fun! Brunch is about $40 per person, includes unlimited dimsum from a menu over about 15 options and unlimited drinks for up to 90 min. There was 4 in our group and we made our way through the menu with time to spare! Only gripe was the amount of dimsum in a serving. We had to split the dumplings in a few of the orders -- would be great if they portioned it appropriately for the number in a party, especially for items like dumplings which are harder to share! We didn't want to place a whole new order just for 1 dumpling!
author: Samantha G.

description:
Cool vibe and the food is good. Great music too. The reason for the low rating was the lame, negative and sarcastic attitude of the manager after sending a bad glass of wine back. The wines they have to offer there aren't bad, but the keg tap system they use to store and pour them must allow for too much oxygen ingress so the red wines go bad quickly is my guess. 3 different glasses of wine and they were all pretty bad. Bad wine doesn't at all deter me from coming back - I couldn't care less and would go with a beer next time. But to feel uncomfortable because of the snooty comment from the manager on the way out does. Customer should come first. Management should also figure out how to handle a tiny & highly frequent restaurant situation with more maturity.

-We also felt really rushed the whole time
author: Cole W.

description: This has to be one of the my favorite places to eat in the city. Now, while the Marina is the typical go to noodle neighborhood, this place is worth the long bus rid out there!  The garlic noodles are amazing! The first time I visited here there was an off menu fried chicken plate that was seriously amazing!  Definitely highly recommend, even if there is a wait, well worth it. Be sure to hear what's on special and off the menu for that day... You don't want to miss the special plates.
author: Katherine E.

description: Chubby Noodle is Asian fusion done right, with the right traditional flavors blended with a Californian twist. All of their dishes are served family style, which is definitely the best way to try as much as possible from the menu. My boyfriend and I started with the pork ribs (which are considered a small plate but are really a pretty generous portion), which had a sweet and sour vinegar soy glaze on the outside. The ribs weren't overly sauced, and the cook on the meat was perfect so that it was tender and just falling off the bone. We then had the BBQ pork fried rice, which had really authentic flavors and wasn't too greasy at all. My favorite dish of the night was the garlic noodles. The homemade noodles were tossed in a simple spicy, garlicky sauce that was pure comfort food. Everything seems to come highly recommended at Chubby Noodle, and I'll undoubtedly be back to try it all.
author: Ashley T.

description:
I have eaten at Chubby Noodle when it was a part-time restaurant in the back of Amante in North Beach.  I like the food.  It's tasty!  So I was excited to be invited for opening night.

That being said, this is not really a restaurant.  It's like a beer, wine and sake lounge that serves a limited number of dishes.  I think they made the most of a small space, and there are booths and high barstool tables.  But it's still a very small space and tables fill up fast.

The staff has to work out the timing for dinner service if it wants to be a real restaurant.  The food came out in weird fits and bursts.  The owner, a hostess, and a couple of different servers were all checking on us at different times, but still... one of my friends waited 45 min for his food and the rest of us had finished eating everything.  And with the long stretched out timing, I didn't really feel full at the end of the meal.  

So... it's good and it's bad.  It really depends on your expectations and how much time you have to kill.  I wouldn't come here and just wait for a seat for the dinner.  I would not come here with any group larger than 4 people.  Just thinking about that makes me feel hangry.

But if I was hanging out with just one other person, we weren't super hungry, and we just wanted to get some snacks with a beer or wine... I wouldn't mind waiting for a seat.
author: Needles K.

description: Great food. Cool seating area and an opportunity to meet new people. Staff is very friendly. Good place to hang out
author: Lena K.

description: The food is very fresh. Loved the bok choy and wontons. Only complaint is the music - way too loud. We couldn't hear each other talk.
author: Christina S.

description: Chubby Noodle was a very pleasant surprise. The service could not have been better. We showed up just before brunch ended, but the staff was very accommodating in getting us a table as soon as dinner service started. The food was awesome - we were really impressed with the Korean tacos and garlic noodles. Highly recommended.
author: Michael Z.

description:
One of my favorite spots to hit up after a twilight round at the Presidio! Pete and Nick have done a fantastic job of keeping a fun loud environment enjoyable with sake on tap, wine, beer and amazing food courtesy Chef Pete Mrabe. 

Some of the stand outs for me: 

- Spicy Wontons 
- Papaya Salad 
- Kung Pao Wings 
- BBQ pork fried rice 
- Chilli ramen and the spicy garlic noodles 
- Drown it down with the Push Back Sav Blanc or the "cold tea"
author: Sareen Capital S.

description:
Best restaurant in SF. 

Woah. Bold. Am I hearing you right young man? BEST restaurant in SF?

Yes. 

Granted, I live in LA and I'm not a foodie by any means, but when I came here with my girlfriend on Night 53, the dining experience was perfect. Not the kind of perfect where nothing's wrong, but the kind of perfect where wrong doesn't matter. 

Must orders: 
* Tuna poke (comes with shrimp chips!)
* Garlic Noodles
* Bok Choy
* Cambodian Beef

Bonus: 90's hip-hop and R&B playlist. 
Lastly, Mark was a fantastic waiter, helped us navigate the menu and timed everything just right. Will be back next time I'm in town.
author: Yan Z.

description:
We walked in (like 2 steps in) and immediately got the signal to wait right there. Seems like the waiter was annoyed that people kept walking in without waiting to get seated. I tend to think something like that is due to really bad design. No signs and the waiting table was hiding right next to the door opening. Also, generally, it's not nice to be greeted with smelly face and rude gestures. 

The restaurant was half full but we had to wait for another 5 minutes to get seated. Needless to say, we walked right back out.
author: May G.

description:
First off, the food here is amazing and that is always what I base my reviews on. However, the atmosphere was really bad and I can't overlook it. To preface, the server was really nice and had recommendations and made us feel welcome.  I had read before going that there was loud music and that's not a huge deal to me. The music was up pretty high and was early '00s hits, which I can usually dig. However, about 2/3 of the restaurant was apparently a large party and they were screaming and dancing and singing in this very tiny space. It was really rude and disrupting. Normally I wouldn't blame this on the restaurant, it's not their fault that some people over do it, but no one ever asked them to tone it down and at one point they even turned up the already loud music to try to cover up the sound of the party, which made it impossible to talk to anyone else at our table. 

In a scenario like this when a large rowdy party is taking up the majority of the restaurant I think the restaurant should have required them to book out the whole thing. I saw one table walk out because of it and we definitely won't be going back.
author: Petra M.

description:
This is a restaurant that REALLY wants to be a nightclub. It's as if someone watched "Night at the Roxbury" wasted, thought it was a documentary about restaurant attire and proceeded. Loud, LOUD "music" and very cramped seating. Did I mention LOuD music? As in, you have to SHOUT into the person across the table's ear to have a chance to be heard. It was ridiculous and strangely amusing, especially when I embodied Will Farrell and let myself be engulfed by the chaos. 

Oh, and they also serve food so I should mention that.. Actually, even though our waitress messed up the order because the noise interceded, she was awesome at friendliness and patience. Like a warm angel accepting her probable lot in life to be deaf by 35. Other staff were also handling things like a champ, and the manager seemed like a good man. 

On to the food: basically avoid the salads but the $10 chicken chow mein was actually pretty good and I'd even order it again. Well, as long as they do take away. Too many Rush concerts in my youth have put a dent in my own hearing and becoming a regular at this place would soon add hearing aids to the list of "to-dos" each morning. 

Overall, probably everything that is right and wrong in the Marina can be summarized by the existence of this little place....
author: T J.

description:
What exactly is Chubby Noodle's selling point? If you ask me, I'd have to admit they failed to impress me with their Americanized rendition of a Pan Asian menu. My two friends and I came in just after 6pm and luckily swooped one of the last booths before the entire restaurant really filled up. We ordered the garlic noodle (and add $3 for BBQ pork, seriously?!!?), the kung pao chicken, and the salmon sashimi. Each dish ranged from $11-$14 or so. It is meant to be served family style. We first started with the garlic noodles and I swear there was a funky garlic taste to the noodles, like it was spoiled? It had a sour smell to it and it was displeasing. The BBQ pork add on was mediocre. The sashimi was one of my favorites, fresh in taste and lightly dipped into soy sauce base. The kung pao chicken was beyond spicy. It was perfectly fried but the peppers overpowered the entire dish and we couldn't even finish the measly 8 or so pieces. 

Such a bummer that my experience was below my expectations because I had really high hopes for this place. However, if you're curious, I'd say come to try their $37 AYCE brunch menu. Sounds delish!
author: Connie C.

description:
I don't write Yelp reviews often, but I felt that I needed to after my experience last night. I went with a group at 5:30 on a Saturday. Although we were the only people at the restaurant, they refused to turn the music down. The music is SO LOUD, would could barely carry on conversations, even though we were seated close together. 

I did like the food. Although I have to agree with other reviews, there were no 'chubby noodles' to be had. And my hands swelled up so much after eating their salty food, I couldn't get my rings off.

I would consider getting take out from here, maybe. But I would never, ever eat at the restaurant again. It's just so miserably loud, that we couldn't wait to get out of there.
author: Shel S.

description: Great food, better atmoshphere. We went here on a whim and it turned out great. Really recommend the garlic noodles with pork my fiancé can't stop raving about them. Great spot.
author: Lamonte B.

description:
Ordered the spicy garlic noodles, ramen noodles, wings, and korean tacos. 

The tacos were 5 stars. Very flavorful with juicy pork that melts in your mouth. Worth coming to the restaurant and ordering just this. 

Everything else was 3-star food. Tasted like cheap bland fast food to me. 

Fun atmosphere but the hip hop could've been slightly less loud.
author: Julie N.

description: Not many items on the menu but it's soooo good. Had the dumplings, spare ribs, pork fried rice and Chinese chicken salad! Bomb
author: Colette P.

description:
NOT the same as the Chubby Noodle located inside Amante in North Beach. Found this out after sitting down and opening the menu, unfortunately... my bad for not checking in advance, I guess, but still -- it's strange to co-brand it and not keep some of the key elements of what made the original location popular (i.e., garlic noodles, ramen...), as I don't think I'm the first to make this mistake. The menu is organized by themes (noodles, meat, seafood, dim sum), and it's a mish-mash of Japanese (hamachi), Korean (japchae), and Chinese (dim sum items, cumin lamb) dishes -- does that make it Asian fusion? Unclear. But it made me confused as to what was going on.

We ordered:
HAMACHI - the only standout of the entire meal. would i come back for it? no, but if i were forced to eat here again, i would order this.
SHRIMP SHUMAI - came with 5 pieces, which I found weird since i've never seen this serving size in any chinese restaurant i've been to, usually it's in portions of 3-4. For our party of two, this was especially awkward. also it wasn't that good.
SCALLION BREAD - i don't remember much about this dish either way.
CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP - this came recommended, but was terrible. underseasoned, overcooked noodles that did not taste fresh, lots of salt but still managed to be extremely bland. very small portions of fried chicken. did not finish this.

Service was very friendly, since we went the first week the owner came and introduced the menu. My one piece of feedback here would be that w/o even asking us what we wanted to order (which we did, after studying the menu on our own), he proceeded to launch into a detailed explanation of both the drink and food menu, which we were forced to listen to politely for over 5 minutes. I think this would have been perfectly okay had we asked him for recommendations, but we didn't, we were hungry and ready to order. Totally understand that it was the first week and he's proud of the menu and the thought / detail that's gone into it, but the customer's needs still come first.

Still think the place had a nice, laid back vibe and it has potential if they work on their menu and take a page out of their North Beach sister restaurant's notebook in terms of menu offerings.
author: Jessica W.

description: Need to try brunch still because I hear their bottomless mimosas and dim sum are good on weekends. Dinner was overpriced for what it was when I've had similar at Asian restaurants and even food trucks, but I understand they have to deal with raised rent and bougie drinks and atmosphere.  It's sort of Asian fusion but also random odds and ends of anything that's a "fad" food in Asian fusion right now. Like the bau, garlic noodle, and string beans
author: Kristin C.

description:
4.5 Stars

All in all this place was bomb. Loved the decor, arrangement, seating etc. Showed up at 5:30 on a Thursday and walked right in with my buddy and my little boy. Hes only 7 months old but he sat up well propped next to me in the booth. 
It didn't appear they had high chairs and the seating was mostly fixed so just an FYI for you parents out there. Now for what matters, the food.

We began with the tuna poke and the chicken wings. The tuna was excellent and came out in 3 minutes flat. The wings were awesome but did take 20 minutes to get. We were told this is because they are double fried. We also had the bbq pork rice which beat the wings to the table. I could have used a little more seasoning in the rice itself but the pork was oh so good! Adding to the carb load we opted for the garlic noodles next. They were delish! I had hopes they wold be spicy but I think the chicken wings blew my spice sensor off the scale. Not like the wings were so crazy spicy or anything but the noodles werent even close to the same heat level so its hard to say. We finished the meal with the Korean tacos. These were good but not as great as I had hoped. I did enjoy the sauce on them though, it almost had this shawarma thing going on that I found very interesting. 

The service was spectacular and attentive. I had a Pine Street Pale Ale beer that I had never had before so that was cool. The beer was very easy on the palate, almost more of a light beer than a typical Cali pale ale but oh well as it washed the food down nicely.

I'm looking forward to going back, thanks Chubby Noodle!
author: Michael B.

description: Amazing food! Everything we are was delicious. Service was good, not great, but fine and they were fast!
author: Lindsay J.

description: I have probably never waited 2 hours for a restaurant before, but it was worth the wait. All I have to say is...Korean pork street tacos, spicy garlic noodles and the short ribs. So delicious!
author: Jordan J.

description:
I had a fun night (went home inebriated) and I was super hangry (b-word) when we got here at 8pm.  Waited at the bar for our table to clear (no reservations) and listened to the broternity members all around me compare penis size (fortunately figuratively). This is probably a decent place for single marina girls to find their future ex boyfriend. 

This is a crowded busy place and it takes some time to get the servers attention. Once we placed our orders, our server was excellent in getting food out to me and I was pleasantly surprised with how tasty everything (except the chicken ramen) was. One of the owners came and introduced himself, he was very gracious.  

The poke is very good as are the wontons.  No dessert but not a big deal. Lots of sake on tap.  Reasonably priced wines. 

If you live nearby it's def worth stopping in.
author: Poppy C.

description:
I really like the food here. It is always fresh and services tends to be quick (we also order take out quite alot from here and normally takes 15-20 minutes tops). There is an open kitchen so you can see the chefs cooking too which is fun.

My favourite is the garlic noodles by far and also a fan of the rice dish.

Only thing i am not a fan of is the seating (a little uncomfortable) and this place is always VERY noisy so it can be hard to have a conversation or hear yourself think!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
I followed yelp reviews and made my way here while staying in San Francisco- so yum! This place has a way low profile so without the reviews we would never have found it even though it's on Lombard. 
The three of us ordered four dishes- all served family style- bbq pork fried rice, chubby chicken chow mein, Korean bow pork tacos, and the dumplings. I am hard pressed to pick a favorite- but those noodles- each bite made you long for another! 
Go early- this place fills up fast!
author: Rhi M.

description: This place is delicious and SUCH a blast! There's no place like it in the city! Tonight we enjoyed a new special - Kobe beef noodles. We sat at the bar; Fernando is the man!
author: Belinda B.

description:
Went for the continued soft opening last night.  Food was excellent (Hamachi was stand out) and the price point was very reasonable.  Mark up on booze was very reasonable and some interesting sake/wine drinks.

Obviously still getting in the swing of things but this place should be great and very excited to see how it matures.  Awesome vibe inside.
author: David G.

description:
Great!!!!! Omg delicious and great service! Definitely highly recommend coming to try! 
Korean pork tacos and the spicy garlic noodles are awesome! Fun and hip atmosphere :) music speakers a bit loud for my taste but adds to the overall young chill relaxed vibe.
author: Grace W.

description: I must say, the food was a bit weak. The spicy garlic noodle dish had no flavor at all. We tried to drown it in soy sauce but that didn't work. The kimchi was way to salty. The spicy green beans were not spicy - again, just no flavor (tasted like beans). Maybe a good place to drink I suppose (if you want to listen to hip hop and R&B). The poke was pretty good - that was definitely the highlight.
author: Nid L.

description: Cool, hip vibe with nice food. Staff were great as was the food. Would be good if they had w few more GF options.
author: Moe K.

description: Amazing food, super fun atmosphere, especially for Saturday and Sunday brunch!! They have music blasting, I mean not too loud but it makes you want to get up and dance! Everything on the menu is delicious, the chow mein, shrimp and chicken dumplings, the duck, fried rice with shrimp; the food was so good. And if you go for dinner you definitely have to try their famous tacos.
author: Jackie S.

description: I read so many reviews and was excited to try. I have to say the food was unimpressive, rather mediocre. It all had the same note. I wouldn't return.
author: Constance M.

description: This place...THIS place! From the friendly staff, to the interesting and delicious wines on tap, to the fantastic owner Nick, this is a winner already, but once you start layering in the food. THE food!!! Well, then your really in heaven! The dishes come out from the kitchen as they are ready so best to come with people you like cuz these plates are made to share. I am in love with the salmon sashimi. It's rich and buttery with a creamy aioli topped with a tiny fried herb to counter balance all the smooth with a little crunch, plated in a delicious sweet vinegar sauce, you can't beat it!!  The garlic noodles are a house favorite and you can't go wrong!! The sizzling ribeye was so perfectly prepared there are no words. The salt and pepper prawns are so off the charts delicious it obscene. Bottom line, come hungry and get here early the lines can get pretty long after 8/8:30.
author: S T.

description:
I've been 4 or 5 times now and every single time the service has been fantastic. Totally superior from the bartenders to the servers to the manager.  And each and every time was incredibly fun. The food is excellent... definitely recommend the pork ribs and salmon sashimi.

This isn't a place for a quiet date or family meal with kids, but if you want a great night with friends and some 90s jams bumping on the jukebox, Chubby Noodle is highly recommended.
author: David G.

description: Loved the vibe here.  The service was outstanding.  I couldn't stop eating the pork tacos and the spicy noodles.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Jim A.

description:
Stumbled upon chubby noodle one night looking for a place to have a light dinner.

Split the wings and breakfast jock. The wings were good, not great. Mix of spicy and sweet. The breakfast jook was excellent. Egg with rice porridge bacon etc. multiple flavors , complex and delicious. Would def come here again.
author: Adam G.
