description: Excellent flavors! The Korean pork tacos and duck lettuce wraps pack a punch but lean on the greasy side. The garlic noodles have a homemade chewiness and tend to be bland but the garlic and sauce make up for it. The tuna poke is really delicious with delicate soy and sesame touches. Beer choices are excellent. I recommend the Japanese porter and (Japanese) Belgian ale. Only complaint: Turn down the effin tunes! I don't mind music of any kind at a restaurant but the volume was so ear-shattering that waitstaff had to yell at us and we could barely converse.
author: Eric M.

description: We had the best food here. Fried rice was on point. Chicken with sauce was on point. Ribs were soft and melted in our mouth. Our server, Fernando, was the best host we have had. Fernando gave us the best experience. Thanks Fernando, we love you!
author: Dev I.

description: During our stay in San Francisco, my boyfriend and I randomly chose this place last minute because we were starving. If you are from a small town going to a big city, you'll find it hard to find the place because the place didn't have a sign. Luckily there were other customers outside smoking and told us we were at the right spot. When we've gotten inside, the music was loud which we didn't mind and enjoyed. For our taste though, the place was too dark and found it hard to see our food. The lights were too dim. Place was crowded and we were seated right at the end by their storage area which we found kind of annoying since the workers kept walking, grabbing things right beside us. Didn't like that much. I actually waited a while to get my food while my boyfriend had gotten his pretty fast. My boyfriend and I are both Asian and their chow mein and pad Thai tasted generic. I guess some people have their own preference but my boyfriend and I weren't satisfied. We probably won't be going there again.
author: Pazau X.

description:
Yay for Chubby Noodle. Never been in the original "pop-up" so this was going to be a treat. We made a reservation for 7pm Saturday. Came in about 10 minutes early and got promptly seated at one of the chefs tables. We were greeted by Nick, one of the owners and the wait staff. Wow--friendly, fun atmosphere going on, good music and an energy "buzz" we love. Sake on tap was great. We ended up ordering at least half the menu and did our best to finish it. The fish was outstanding (snapper I believe), also the scallops and shrimp--all winners! Chef/Owner Pete does an amazing job. Try all the dishes, you will be back for more.  
Yes, the place is small. Make a reservation. It WILL be worth it!!
author: Mark W.

description: This place is "Happenin" music up and the food is terrific!!  I appreciate an "experience"  either in ambiance or food, this place has both...feels like a party folks so, if you're into quiet, not a good choice...If your energy is high, probably one of the best spots in SF
author: David G.

description: The quality of food is on par with Panda Express, except you get less portions for double the price. Not sure what the craze is about.
author: Frank W.

description:
The service at this new location is excellent. I went within the first couple of weeks of opening and you could tell the kitchen and food were still getting things together but the service (Nick, specifically, and the hostess) were attentive. 

My big feedback is the view into the kitchen. The chef, poor guy, looked miserably hot, which isn't a great dining experience. It was super smokey in the restaurant as well.

The food was heavy-handed but that's what this place is known for. Extra spicy, salty and fat. I adore the fried chicken at the North Beach location but the one we had in the form of chicken thighs cut up into nuggets didn't have the same juiciness. It tried to compensate by being really salty.

The best thing was the hot friend snapper. The scallion bread was alright, but not a must-have.

This is the place for late-night eats and greasy indulgence.
author: Nicola L.

description: If you like shanghai dumplings, like myself, do not order them here. They are actually chicken chinese 5-spice steamed buns and that was an absolute letdown. Besides that, the green beans were actually phenomenal and it was nice how they give you a little rubber duck in your drink. It traveled with my friends and I the rest of our boozey sunday. I give this place 2 stars because I can't get over their false advertisement of the dumplings, most of the food was actually more of a 3 star experience. Food also comes out of the kitchen creepily close to the bathroom which is a little strange considering the entire kitchen is open air alongside the dining area.
author: Robbie S.

description: Food is good but overpriced. Music is WAY too loud. Can't hear anyone talk. We got the Korean tacos which were good but not worth the 5.50 per taco. The noodles were good and reasonably priced. No beers on tap was a disappointment
author: Rajan S.

description:
We expected a lot more based on the high rating on Yelp. We got the recommended Korean Pork Tacos which were overly greasy and bland tasting. Also ordered the garlic noodles which were subpar compared to "An the Go" food truck. The Tuna Poke was small for the price and flavorless. Maybe we ordered the wrong things but everything we got was boring and underwhelming.

Worst part was that the ventilation was so poor (kitchen is in same room as dining area) that we felt like we were getting hit with tear gas and pepper spray. We (and several other restaurant guests) were coughing and sneezing because the air got so bad in there. 

After we were finally able to escape the warfare, we joked that we were suffering from "Chili Lung" because we couldn't stop hacking the rest of the night. They should fix this ventilation problem ASAP before they get in trouble with a city health inspector. Even our server acknowledged that it happens frequently!

They do an excellent job of getting people in and out the door with quick delivery of the food, however the beers we ordered took 15 minutes to arrive--in fact they didn't get to the table until after our first dish got served!

We definitely won't be coming back.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Finally, some liveliness on Lombard Street! Chubby Noodle occupies the corner off Steiner, look for the signage of, you guessed it, chubby noodles. 

Definitely enjoyed the fun, upbeat atmosphere. They have a combination of 2-tops, 4-tops, and communal tables. It's true, they play some seriously awesome 90s tunes here. I would have liked to sample more dishes, but we enjoyed the garlic noodles and wings. Service was consistent, special shoutout to the super sweet hostess. 

I'll be back! I've heard great things about the pork tacos :)
author: Brianna M.

description:
This place is really good and is run by great people. There is sake on tap, delicious food that reminds you of an asian variety of the chef's first restaurant with the big spicy flavors of don pistos. 

It's a fun atmosphere; Nick and Pete will show you a great time.
author: Matt W.

description:
Amazing time!! I loved it here. My girlfriend and I stopped by last Saturday for dinner and we thought we would have to wait forever, only waited for about 30 mins. Walked to a bar close by had a drink and got a text that our table was ready. 
The food was amazing! We shared a plate of noodles and each had the tacos. Get them! So good! 
Favorite part was the atmosphere. They had such a fun playlist playing! And the music was the perfect volume too it wasn so loud you had to yell or that it interrupted conversation. We danced in our chairs while we are our yummy food. Definitely check this place out! Our experience was great from beginning to end.
author: Letty B.

description: Stopped by and ordered a couple take out dishes. The spicy garlic noodles and the Korean pork tacos with chili yogurt dip and cucumbers. I'm still munching on the cucumbers and yogurt dip yumm. The spicy noodles we'd had before and they are supper freaking spicy but so tasty I can't not eat them even knowing I'll have hellashish heart burn for two days. Soo good! Now to the tacos. They are insanely good. You've got to try them. Will defiantly be back again.
author: Candia M.

description: So much fun! DJ playing music, a really fun and friendly bartender, and good food. Great to go in a big group, and service was good. I love bottomless drinks and food for only $37 bucks! I had a great time.
author: Annie J.

description:
Came here during soft opening, super friendly, really cool vibe. Open kitchen, good food, not quite great, but very good, especially for soft opening. We tried a variety if dishes including noodles and all would be ordered again. Will post more detailed update when I go back after it's open for normal business. 

No name on the restaurant anywhere if u trying to find it, just funky sign of fat noodle in a bowl
author: auclair k.

description:
Second time here. Like this place. 

Definitely order the garlic noodles. Fantastic. Salt and pepper prawns are great too. Used to be a beef dish on the menu that was good as well.

Can sometimes feel kinda cramped and a little loud, but that's the only downside. 

Great addition to the Marina.
author: Scott C.

description: Great food. Super fun atmosphere. Overall fantastic place to go! Be sure to get the Poke!!
author: David E.

description: Walked right in on a Sunday night (after Christmas) and was greeted by a friendly hostess. Have never been here before so we ordered a couple different things and all were amazing. Must try the spicy garlic noodle - will be craving these back on the east coast! Wontons were like dumplings and served in a yummy sauce. I had the special wonton soup which was HUGE and delicious. After we finished our meal we didn't want to leave because the music was awesome! Throwback jams from early 2000's (including ice cream paint job). The atmosphere was great and the food was even better.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday based on Yelp reviews. I had the garlic noodles, ceviche, beef tacos, and sliced salmon. The ceviche was very disappointing, the taste was odd and not what I was expecting. It comes in 2 bowl shaped chips, and did not taste like any ceviche I've had before. The avacado threw me off. Was looking forward to a vinegar taste, but it was almost too sweet. Could hardly taste the fish in it. The slice salmon was OK, nothing spectacular. The garlic noodles are a hit on Yelp, and I was really looking forward to it. It was good, but imo a little too spicy. The best dish was definitely the beef tacos. It was the salvation of the entire meal. Great taste, and whatever sauce they used was spectacular. 

I enjoyed the music, the 90's hiphop is right up my alley. Some people are saying that it was too loud, but I didn't feel like it was.

One glaring thing that took away from the experience was when a dish was "lost on the ticket" or something, and my friend had to wait until after everyone had finished eating before being brought his ramen noodles. It was taken off the check but the waittress had brought up ramen noodles like 3 times and how "they were on their way". But clearly they were not. Overall, the Chubby Noodle falls slightly below what my expectations were based on the reviews here. I would probably not dine here again.
author: D B.

description: Not everyone wants $37/per person AYCE brunch. That's expensive! Learn how to accommodate guests who come in and just want to try your food. Looked at the menu & its not all that. Small place: seats on the left then bar on the right. Will think about trying it again...
author: Thomas C.

description: Delicious Tacos. They are one of the best tacos I have tasted. The ambiance is a bit too loud and the prices and on the higher side, but the food is great.
author: Andrea S.

description: I'm new to the city but I'm so glad this place was one of the first restaurants I found. First off it has such a cool vibe with the 90s hip hop music, chill staff, and fun atmosphere. As for the food I've always been amazed with every dish I order. I highly recommend the chili prawn noodles and the flounder for entrees. Also the Kung pow wings might be my favorite wings ever. They're not too spicy, just the right amount. I also love the cold tea - it's a minty ginger sake drink.
author: Senna P.

description: Mark and the rest of the staff there are amazing! Had so much fun at Saturday brunch and the food was awesome. It can get noisy b/c it gets crowded and the music can be a little loud so I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who wants an intimate, quiet dinner.
author: Alli B.

description:
we were going to go back to a place we knew but it was closed. we found Chubby they had a table for three. one of the best coincidence as this place was amazing. service was delightful, menu fantastic. papaya salad had a great kick, pork tacos were tender and well balanced, pork ribs so moister and spiced well. salmon marinated and ceviche both were perfect.
only minus is say is the wine. paying $55 for a liter served in a pitcher.. not my thing. I'd change this for sure but overall I'd recommend the place.
author: Christophe K.

description: We had the Koran tacos, pork fried rice, and garlic noodles. They were all amazing and so unique! Our waitress was very nice and the place was super clean. I would highly recommend this place!!!
author: kelly w.

description: I Crave this place all the time!! Went here for their brunch when I came down to visit some friends. We got almost everything on their menu and I truly couldn't deiced what I loved more. The chicken chow mien is still the best I've had!
author: Katie M.

description: Came out here on the weekend and the wait was an hour and a half!! But man was it worth it!!! The food was delicious, atmosphere great, and the absolutely gorgeous hostess brought us some sake drinks to warm us up while we were waiting! Definitely will be back!
author: Robert D.

description:
Great food. Miniscule portions.
I ordered via Postmates last night.
The turnaround time was great.
But, 2 very small tacos for $11?!
Throw a 3rd one in there, at least.
author: Jason K.

description: Mediocre asian food served in an eclectic/hip-hop atmosphere in the Cow Hollow neighborhood. As I live in the neighborhood I've been here a few times to give it the old college try. No dish, especially their noodles, have been much to write home about. Provides calories and another decent place to grab a beer - though it's location directly on Lombard street isn't exactly ideal. The concept is good, in execution not so much.
author: Chris P.

description: Mixed review. Limited menu, but food was tasty. Staff was hit or miss. Music was too loud at 5:00 on a Wednesday. I couldn't hear the waitress talking the music was so loud. I would recommend going there after 8 or 9pm at night, it's definitely a party/pick up scene. Food came out quickly, portions were small so we had to order more. Undecided if I'll go back.
author: K S.

description:
This place is amazing! Limited menu where the owner and chefs have put their heart into every item. The chicken noodle soup (with fried chicken!!) and meatball jook are fantastic. The owner encourages sharing giving individual bowls to scoop from the larger. Scallion bread and pork shrimp shumai are great appetizers and the accompanying sauces pair perfectly. Highly recommend dipping the fried chicken in the sriracha mayo and adding the spicy sauce with roasted garlic to the broth. AMAZING. Wash it down with the cold tea. 

Your taste buds will thank you.
author: Heather K.

description: This is one of my favorite places in SF for a weekend brunch. I come here almost every time when my friends come up from LA. They love it too. It's a great take on what I would group off as asian/ dimsum/ and a hint of american fusion.
author: Jason Y.

description: Love the vibe. Pork tacos were delicious as was the papaya salad. Really friendly and attentive staff too.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
A little disappointed by my first visit to Chubby Noodle. The reviews and high ratings made me really excited to finally try Chubby Noodle. The food wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't good. For a place that
s named for their noodles, you would think the noodles would be amazing. They were under-seasoned and just overall average. The portion sizes were also small for the price. There is also a selection of Japanese beers, all between $10-12. We assumed that these would be on draft because of the price, but they came in cans. Definitely over-priced. You can find better noodles for far cheaper.
author: Sara H.

description: Came up to SF to visit my sister and her roomie recommended this place, sooo happy he did! We asked our super nice waitress what was popular and got everything she recommended...the poki, chow mein, garlic noodles, korean tacos, braised short ribs and the homemade kimchi. Everything was delish but especially the tacos and short rib. I am definitely planning on coming back next time I'm in SF
author: Beckie P.

description:
Terrible service, and overpriced underwhelming food.

Went here for dinner with my fiance.  First the hostess did not sit us at the first open table because we were a party of 2 and the tables were booths and 4 tops and she said she couldn't sit us there so we watched multiple parties come in and sit right away because they were groups of 3 or 4 while we had to wait an hour.  Once getting sat, we ate the tuna poke and the chile prawns noodles.  The tuna poke was over salted and the chile prawns noodles were way too heavy handed on the spice.  The food wasn't so terrible but definitely not very good and not worth waiting an hour for.  Would not recommend it was very overrated.
author: Brian K.

description: The garlic noodles was good, but everything else was ok.  I was hoping they had pork belly bun and fried chicken in their menu, but they did not.
author: Cijay P.

description: Too many  good things to eat here and the menu is not even that long.  But there is nothing on there that is not delicious and the food is exceptional value.  Even if you are a skilled chef, you could not make food this good at this price, even making it from scratch.  Garlic thick udon noodles, their signature Korean Tacos (go early before they run out), salt and pepper prawns, amazing pork ribs, best tuna poke since Hawaii, and more.  Easy street parking.  Very cute place.
author: James T.

description: Amazing food, scene, and music. They recommend the spicy garlic noodles which were great but so was everything else we got. Definitely get the tacos and ribs but you're not going to go wrong with anything else on the menu.
author: Andrew M.

description: I was pleasantly surprised at the flavoring and seasonings used. The owner of this venue was very accommodating and friendly which made the amazing food that much better. The restaurant is pretty small and ambiance resembled a friendly local bar. Would definitely check this place out again in the future
author: Axle K.

description: This has been the best and worst thing for me since they moved in across the street from my apartment.  Amazing food, awesome service, and the music is aimed to get your night going.  Not a good spot if you want to have a quiet dinner and catch up.  More of a pre game atmosphere--even on a Sunday. Must haves: Tuna poke, garlic noodles (order two), pork fried rice, and korean pork tacos.  Also good for takeout!
author: Mary S.

description: After going by all the positive reviews, we decided to go here for dinner . We were not disappointed , everything we had was seasoned so well with just enough spice where you could still taste everything . The ribs were moist , fell right off the bones and in this delicious sauce which I wish I could take home . The tuna poke, give me more!!! Light tasty and delissss .. My only problem , music way to loud . It's not a club , I want to be able to hear the person I'm sitting with . Otherwise 5 stars .. Next time I'm in town I'll stop in for sure
author: Olga K.

description: Delicious.   The salt and pepper shrimp, the garlicky noodles, kimchi, and pork bbq tacos were killer.   So delicious. Questionable music but solid food.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Amazing food. You got to try it. 
spicy garlic noodle and pork tacos were my favorite
author: Kimberly S.

description: What a disappointing experience. The Korean tacos were dramatically over priced at $11.00.  They were unremarkable.  The garlic noodles were overly spiced with jalapeno.  $11.00 for a noodles with no protein is way over the market rate.  Experience was subpar.  I used Caviar for the delivery service and when you add in the fee and the tip the whole experience is not wort the money.  There are tons of other noodle places in the area were you get a better deal and superior quality food.  Don't be a hipster douche and don't bother to eat at Chubby Noodle.
author: Ben V.

description:
This place is awesome and the food is FANTASTIC!!!  There was the usual 30-40 minute wait on a Saturday night at 9pm. But luckily we're able to find seating at the bar. The bartender, Fernando, was great!  He helped us with food and drink recommendations. Food was quick and super good. We got the Spicy Garlic Noodles and Chubby Chow Mein both with prawns.  Both were very different and really tasty. Id highly recommend both.  

Word on the street the Korean Pork Tacos are bomb. We will definitely come back to try the tacos and the raw dishes!  Definitely check out this place if you haven't been here before.  Atmosphere was fun too with great 90's rap/hip hop music. Two Thumbs Up!!
author: Gigi M.

description: Came in for brunch right as they opened. Food was great and so were the drinks. We were a hungry party of three and able to try all the dishes. By the time we left, the place was a zoo. Come early.
author: Janell H.

description:
3 Stars for the food and 4 Stars for the drinks.

The dishes were alright, we've tried most of the dim sums.  Most of them were quite salty so you definitely need a side of rice to balance out the saltiness of the dishes.  I'd recommend the Chilled Ramen, Pek King Duck, Kung Pow Wings, and Rice Rolls (again, I warned you about the saltiness).

The mimosa was great, even though it says 4 drink maximum, they'd still give you more which was fabulous.  The key is not to be drunk so I understand about the maximum.  

I've had better dim sum places though, nice place though.  Nice workers.  Pretty loud but it's a brunch restaurant and in the Marina (douche neighborhood).
author: Dee L.

description: Awesome place to go with friends and get a few drinks and order some small plates...The shrimp and the kung pao wings were awesome. The noodles were ok. We went with our nine year old and felt out of place on a Sunday. So not recommended for kids for sure. Reservations are reccomended
author: Sumant J.

description: Never had a chance to try the food so can't comment there.  I live in the neighborhood and wanted to try something new.  I walked in on a Tuesday evening, meeting a friend, she was walking down from her place.  I was told to stand in the bar area until my friend arrived.  The place is small so it felt awkward to stand in the bar area since it isn't really removed from the rest of the place.  I just wanted to sit down and both servers told me to wait. So my friend arrives and the server chooses to put us at some tiny table with 2 stools in the corner near some boxes of restaurant supplies.  There is a booth wide open, has been vacant for 10 minutes at least.  She rudely states that she wants to keep the table for 4 people, while every other booth in the place is occupied by only 2 people.  I walked out. I get the 4 people thing but I wasn't going to sit at the kid table and there was another table vacant that 6 people could have sat at easily.  Why keep a paying customer standing looking at a vacant table?  I wanted to sit down and order something and get my dinner started.  This is poor business sense in my opinion so you can keep your asian fusion hipster spot...plenty plenty other places to eat asian in SF without the attitude...and by the way I've been in the restaurant biz my whole life there's no substitute for treating people with respect, don't care how good the food is.
author: Hip P.

description:
House sake = awesome

Chicken buns dim sum is bomb, the bbq pork fried rice was ridiculously delicious,  I really dug the flounder dish which was light and fresh. I am allergic to shrimp but my friends loved the wontons and basil shrimp dishes.

Hip-hop soundtrack, on point.  Ask for table 31 (aka as I learned, Rambis Table), you're half in the kitchen.

So good I came back two nights in a row on my 48 hour trip to SF.  Can't wait to return.
author: Craig N.

description: Really fun atmosphere with great music and delicious meals. It is a little on the pricy side but the friend rice and garlic noodles are a good bang for your buck.
author: Ryan O.

description: Good vibe, great service, food is just ok. Make sure you get the Korean pork tacos though, they were worth it!
author: Nora X.

description: Salty salty and salty, did I mentioned salty? The first thing we noticed when we walked in is that we are the only Asians in this "Asian" restaurant.  The place is small, if you are 40 years old, you are the oldest person in this place, the music was blasting really loud, so loud that every time the phone rings, the manager had to walk outside to take togo orders.  Back to the music, like I said, if you are 40 years old, you are too old, if your child is under 12, they are too young because blasting out of their speakers is nothing but "f*ck this b*tch", "f*ck that b*tch", "I want mo money for hookers and p*ssy" and this sh*t goes on for hours.  How's the food? Well I lied about it being salty because their duck lettuce wrap was just bland and dried, and to make to make it worst, the meat is shredded sitting on a hot iron flat top, so it dries out further as you eat it.  The "Korean" tacos was nothing to write home about, the meat, once again was dried, and damn salty.  What's missing is some kind of Kimchi or pickle, something sweet and sour to add to the tacos, instead of a couple of salty pieces of meat and a salty dressing on top.  The most disappointed item was the "ribs", you figured since it is sitting in a pool of soy sauce and vinegar, it should be moist, instead, once again, its dried and salty. The rest was just average, the Papayi Salad, the Garlic Noodle ($10 for a small bowl of nothing but noodle?), the 7UP from the bottle was good.  Crowded, loud, overpriced average food, and its the only Asian restaurant where I felt out of place.
author: Hieu L.

description: The food is okay.  Nothing special.  Basically intro pan asian food for the inexperienced foodie.  The service was nice enough.  The reason for the two stars is the combination of the entire experience.  I get playing loud music later in the evening to the demographic of this neighborhood.  But seriously at 6 p.m. with kids listening to "I got 99 problems and a b*tch ain't one" (that was the mildest song) is absolutely poor judgement on the managements part.
author: Amanda P.

description: I recently got to check out Chubby Noodle and basically ordered everything on the menu and I can say I loved every bit of it. First of all, I loved the music and loved the atmosphere. The music is not that loud, as some people have mentioned unless you don't like music at all. I thought it was refreshing, and most importantly, the food was delicious. My favorites were the tacos and the cold ramen noodles. Oh and the sake cocktail! So yummy.  This place is great for a group, or a date night spot.  I loved the relaxed and modern atmosphere, which I think reflected the menu overall as well.
author: Jeanne M.

description: LOVE IT HERE. Food is always so amazing! Good prices and nice staff. It is noises and small so maybe not great for a group unless you feel like waiting a while. Wings are super spicy but delicious. I always go for a rice dish and am never disappointed. Also the dumplings are to die for!
author: AnnaMaria L.

description: Shanghai Dumplings and the Mint tea are unreal here.  Service is excellent and quick.  Highly recommend.
author: Jake T.

description:
Tuna poke and the tacos are to die for. Definitely a restaurant we go back to frequently! 
Owner is super nice too!
author: Lauren E.

description: Small but fun restaurant!  The prawns were SO good - they are a must get along with the garlic noodles.  Definitely want to come back here to try their dim sum bottomless brunch.
author: Cathy B.

description: Damn! First timer here and won't be my last. The food was so good! We tried a variety of plates but what stuck out the most was the pork tacos, short ribs and garlic noodles! Everything was cooked and marinated perfectly. Oh, and did I mention they have Sake on tap!? My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves, our server Angela was very good and courteous. I will definitely be going back the next time I visit SF!
author: Grant G.

description: I am a big fan of chubby noodle and have to say that the korean tacos, fried rice, and garlic noodles are fantastic.  But I'm docking 1 star because the fried chicken strips that are off menu at this location are nothing like the good ones at the north beach location whatsoever.  AND now I just read they're moving from Amante in North Beach and worried they're gonna change the recipe to these chicken strips here at Lombard.  Please don't!
author: a g.

description: Nice place, the staff attentive, and the pork tacos are off the hook, y'all.  Went on a whim and will definitely bring friends and family here.
author: joe m.

description: Struggling to find what was Asian or fusion about this place. No self-respecting Chinese (even ABC) person will walk in here happy and willing to pay $12 for what is essentially chicken chow mein or soy sauce noodles with under seasoned fried chicken. They're not even handpulled! These better be out of this world..i.e. the din tai fung of noodles, noodles. Sadly they were not. I should have known, being the only Chinese person in the restaurant..but my mind was open, plus I like the idea of "chubby" noodles. If your idea if Asian fusion is mixing Hawaiian poke with greasy noodles on par with Panda Express + loud vulgar hip hop ("I ain't fuckin wit you!") then this is your jam. If you are craving something remotely related to "Asian" ("fusion" included if you like loud, non-Asian beats) in a 'hood predominately...white and blond, stop by for some underwhelming soy sauce, fried shit (or find the closest Panda Express. Sadly this would be my first choice). If you want some legit Asian food, I highly recommend Chinatown not far away or I dunno, Slanted Door. Dim sum here? No, thank you.
author: Liz L.

description: I'm always impressed by this place. The food is amazing and the servers are awesome. There's always something new to try on the menu
author: Eric C.

description: ummm YUM! This place is amazing. I had heard good things about Chubby Noodle so I finally decided to try it out since I was in the area and let me tell you I was definitely impressed. The restaurant is a little small and the tables were a little bit too close to each other for my liking but it was totally worth it. I got the spicy garlic noodles with chicken and it was to die for. The price was also super reasonable for dinner in the marina and the location is really convenient.
author: Neilu A.

description: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in the city! The poke tuna, garlic noodles and fried chicken are my go to's. Their service is quick and always friendly and I recommend this place to everyone as a must try!
author: Carly G.

description: This place is awesome. Nick is the man. Its that simple. The food is always super flavorful and delicious. They have Sake on tap! And it is very, very good! How cool is that! Love this place. They are open late enough for me to stop by after work. Always a good time.
author: clint e.

description: The name might be a bit goofy but the food is serious.  Was truly a treat being able to try almost everything on the menu.  The service is impeccable and love how they've styled the place.  Can't wait to be coming back here again and again!
author: Jonathan C.

description: We basically had everything on the menu and it all was good. Started with the house tea which was very interesting. Kinda spicy due to the large amount of ginger, but in a good way. I'd definitely get it again. For food the highlights were: poke, chicken wings, pork, flounder, shrimp basil noodles, won tons. Not sure if I enjoy this menu as much as the original in North Beach, but its worth trying out if you are in the neighborhood...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Yuk!

1. Greasy, sugary sauce drenched over the black bean beef.
2. Raw corner on the Sui Mai.  Raw, not rare. Weird, poor distributed steam set up.
3. Kooky Hostess/owner Lady says all the wrong things, almost a little dishonest.
FOOD SUCKS. 
People cooking it should be noted and avoided if they pop up elsewhere
author: Ame W.

description:
Chubby Noodle is a delicious addition to the Marina dining options that were growing stale to me.

FOOD:  Everything was tasty: the garlic noodles, the crispy prawns, some tartare thing and tacos. I can't remember exactly but I remember we were very pleased and had a hard time deciding what we'd cut next time to try different things on the menu.

DRINKS: They had a $12 bottled beer that my boyfriend loved. I had their house cocktail which was unique and pretty good.

SERVICE: Our waiter was honest and knowledgeable. He checked on us frequently, advised on menu choices, was very personable. Great guy.

MUSIC: THE BEST. It's essentially a playlist from an early 2000s prom. Nothing makes me happier than eating to a Ja Rule classic.

I think for 2, our meal was $100 so it was kind of expensive but we will definitely be back!
author: K C.

description: Saki, saki, and more saki. Glad I tasted the food before hand! Great lineup of eats and a fun place to go before hitting the town.
author: Patrick G.

description: Had drinks here with my bf. Music was loud, lots of people. Most likely would come again in the day time to check out their food. I was too afraid to eat anything since it was so dark.
author: Dee P.

description: I'm at a loss as to why this place only has 4 stars?  The food is pretty amazing and reasonably priced. It has a great vibe and they really utilize the small space. The food is unlike any other place I can think of in the city. It's a pan-Asian-ish place and I'd totally recommend it!
author: Joustin C.

description: Be warned, serving sizes are tiny! The quality of the food is ok, but I don't think the value is there. The music was good and it does appear to be a place that would be good a choice for a light snack and a drink. Not a good option if you're hungry and want a filling meal, you'd be better of going to Ruth's Chris for a $50 steak.
author: Marselis I.

description: The food is amazing here! So flavorful and so many great options. The cold tea is a new favorite of mine! The staff was so friendly and made our group feel so welcome! Love love this place! New favorite of mine for sure!
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
This is my first yelp review or actually... to make it more dramatic, my first review for anything ever so please forgive me if I seem unexperienced with my vernacular or my expression on how I rate, when I rate, why I rate, and/or how often I rate but I promise you this, I will always keep it trill/simple and prove that not all reviewers are "paid" to "hate" or in any other way "motivated" to put down a business. So without wasting any more of your precious time, I'm going to break my experience down for you.

1) Very "hot" spot for that late night snack crave.
("Hot" as in popular and also in the sense that some items really do have serious kick.)

2) Environmentally friendy although also unorthodox to a country boy like me.
- Best ambient music I've ever had while chewing my food. 
(If you're into Pac, Bone Thugz, and Snoop D O double G)
- Even though quite small (what else would you expect in SF?) enough for one with claustrophobia to handle with ease on a packed night. Hopefully.

3) Unquestionably the best service I've ever had by a dude named Mark?
(Couldn't hear very well while I was rapping in my head along with Pac's Dear Mama in the BG)

4) Price is ok? Portion's pretty personal. Is it worth it to go out of your way here? If you're in a mile radius... or if your pregnant wife is nagging you senseless that she's craving the salt and peppered prawns, then you better get your ass over here pronto.

5) Would I recommend this place? Yes but only if you got money to blow and it's the only thing open @ 10:30p.m.

Thank you for making it to the end of my review. I hope it helped you out with making your decisions. lol
author: Jester C.

description: If you want slightly better than average food combined with a rowdy marina atmosphere and ample space for sale bombing then this is the place for you. There are bro's abound though so if you are bothered by the marina scene then this may not be for you.
author: Andrew J.

description: Great vibes and great owner (manager?). The guy running the show was super friendly, accommodated us immediately and we were seated way faster than expected. Food was delicious and well priced for the portions. Prompt service with plenty of check ups. He even came back with free saki for the table to welcome us. They blast a killer playlist too
author: Daniel C.

description:
Friend wanted noodles or chicken wings for dinner and after 30 minutes of searching, we ended up picking chubby noodle. All kinds of Asian fusion food with a bunch of items to satisfy anyone. Arrived at around 7 pm on a Monday and were seated immediately. Dishes were meant to share and we were very full with three dishes for two people although our appetites are def on the small side. 

Food wise we ordered:
-Tuna poke ($13) which was a great appetizer. Fish tasted fresh and had a tasty soy garlic sauce. It also came with shrimp chips which was a nice surprise for me. Maybe a little small but it was good enough to offset the price.
-Kung pow wings ($8) to satisfy the wing craving. They looked like San Tung wings but weren't as good (what wings are though...?). Order came with 6 small saucy wings. They had great flavor and the meat was moist inside. One of the better Asian inspired chicken wings I've tasted and they definitely hit the spot. 
-chile prawn noodles to fulfill our noodle requirement. It looked and smelled amazing. It had wide flat noodles with a dark yellow curry similar to Thai curry. Our server warned us that it was pretty spicy, but I was ready. It doesn't look spicy at all and after the first bite it wasn't spicy at all and I thought tasted a little bland. Oh man was I wrong about both things. Each bite tasted better and better and spicier and spicier! I could not stop eating it, even after my mouth was on fire and my nose was running. You need to try this. My friend agreed that it tasted better and better as you keep eating but she didn't think it was that spicy... No ragrets after eating the dish.
I would definitely come back to try the garlic noodles which were said to be the most popular dish. The Peking duck looked quite tasty. They have a selection of beer and sake as well that looked interesting but we didn't try any since it was a Monday. 

The restaurant itself is small and I could see how there could be a wait. Good luck with parking. Service was A+ as our server, mark, was super friendly and helpful and probably laughed when he saw how much water I drank... Also, I  was jamming to that 90s hip hop playing. Nothing better than having biggie or Btnh rap while you eat.
author: Andy W.

description: Very solid menu and good food. I had the chili shrimp noodles and papaya salad - very yum! My friend ordered the wings, which were delicious but very spicy so be prepared for these! The mix of house music and 90s rap enhances the experience and brought me back to the good ole days :)
author: VegMaster F.

description: Love this place! My boyfriend and I wanted to try somewhere new and came across here. It's open pretty late so that's a major plus. The spicy garlic noodles and the wings there are the bomb! Highly recommend those two. We'll definitely be back :)
author: Tori M.

description:
Went there twice and it was two different experiences. One evening with their standard menu we had an excellent choice of small plates to share and they did not miss a beat on anything. Every single plate was excellent, service was great and the waitperson was very helpful in guiding us through the menu and the sake choices. Based upon this experience I returned on a Sunday for lunch. We were notified it was a prie fixe menu at a set price. Not a good choice! The plates were limited, came out randomly and  the preparation was quite standard. The lure of 'all you can eat' was actually limited. I would not return for a Sunday meal.
I do give kudos for the regular evening menu .
The space is rather cramped like a diner which is ok and part of the experience.
Service is much better during the week.
As the space is limited the noise factor is high and you cannot expect to being part of the next table over conversation. Be aware!
author: Philip S.

description: I'm from Seattle where there are tons of options for Asian food. We decided to try out the chubby noodle and this place is great. Only spot you can get great food and listen to tupac, Dre, and ll cool j. Highly recommend this place
author: Travis S.

description: We were looking for a late night spot easy to get to from the 101 when we came across the Chubby Noodle and boy were we happy! Located on Lombard right on the 101 north, it was easy to get to. This place is hip and young with great decor and loud Hiphop playing. It's got nice booths and bar seating overlooking the open kitchen. The food was bomb! Korean pork tacos, yum. Perfectly spicy and great textures! Spicy garlic noodles and poke were superb as well.
author: Aster B.

description: FIVE star music. FIVE start food! Holly he'll pork tacos are to die. Highly recommend.
author: lexi A.

description: I love the dim sum brunch! Service at the bar awesome we'll definitely be back on later trips
author: Brittney B.

description: Just celebrated my birthday with a Sunday dim sum brunch for the books. I've loved it for dinner already and my first brunch experience was an absolute hit. The food, drinks, staff, environment, music selection and service were all top notch. We had a large group (19) and they handled it professionally from reservation to payment. Nick, thank you for creating such a perfect experience for us. We will be back very soon!
author: Lauren S.

description: Woah. This place was awesome! Sake on tap was B.A (chubby noodle brand) the Tacos were so good we ordered them again at the end of the meal. The vibe was solid. A great new addition to the neighborhood.
author: Sean S.

description: Awesome ambiance, mouth watering food and some of the friendliest service I've ever encountered in San Francisco. My friends were very impressed I'd found this place. Super addition to the neighborhood.
author: Joe G.

description:
If you like attitude this is your place. 

Be warned that their reservation cancellation policy is $20 per person. We argued over this and they finally relented when we said our reservation wasn't ready and we weren't aware of the brunch menu being $37 only and not a la carte. We weren't aware of this when we made the reservations with Yelp. 

If the Marina is your thing and that type of faux Asian food, this place is for you.
author: William N.

description: This place is the bomb. Great music, super energetic atmosphere and fantastic food. What else could you ask for you? Also... Hot hostess. 5 stars.
author: D M Beezy e.

description: We are here from out of town and have heard amazing things about the food in San Francisco. This place did not disappoint! We ordered the duck lettuce wraps, green beans, and spicy garlic noodles and were scraping every last morsel off of the plates! Amazing. We arrived on the early side so we didn't have to wait for a table. Fun atmosphere, but be warned: not a place to bring the little ones as there was music playing that was not censored. Service was great, too! We will definitely be back!
author: Michelle S.

description:
AYCE brunch + drinks. 
Great service, good food. Mimosas/sangrias were good/not super strong but I guess that's good for a all you can drink brunch.
my favorites were the dumplings, salt and pepper shrimp and rice cakes!
author: Rachelle A.

description:
I rarely leave reviews on Yelp, but I had to post about this p[lace. The food is excellent; my cousin and I had dinner here one night and it was great, and the service was great as well.

My complaint? The beer prices are obscene. Outrageous. Unless I'm mistaken, or I read the menu wrong (a very real possibility - between the small type and dim lighting I might be mistaken) a 12-oz. bottle of Japanese pilsner is $12, and a "oil can" size Asahi was $24. Sorry, that's just ridiculous. I also noticed that only the food menu is posted online, which makes me wonder. A shame, because the food is really good.
author: Toby J.

description: Really enjoyed our dinner at Chubby Noodle.  They do great Asian Fusion, the pork ribs and tuna poke were amazing.  They also play great 80s-90s rap music that makes you sing out loud.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Fan-tas-tic. Wonton soup was to die for... Spicy garlic noodles scrumptious. Don't forget to try the Wednesday Cat Belgian Style White Ale. Delightful waitress too. Definitely a win. Oh almost forgot to mention the slamming 90's tunes rockin in the background. Thumbs up.
author: Liana M.

description:
I was excited to see a Chubby Noodle outpost opening in the restaurant wasteland that was the Marina ... but, unfortunately, it seems that the neighborhood mojo can even bring down an established restaurant.

The positive:
- Fun vibe - they were playing 90s hip hop at a fairly-but-not-too-high volume (think Ace Wasbi) - good for people w/o kids
- Flavors - what we had was good, there was nothing I wouldn't order again if I was here
- Friendliness - the service was not too good but it was friendly

The negative:
- Menu - as I've seen mentioned, this is a different menu from the original and missing the best items - friend chicken (the main reason I came) and ramen; also missing pork buns but I didn't think those were great at the other location either
- Service - while friendly, the pace of the serving was really bad; I'm not sure if they are trying to slow serve for some reason (such as to keep the restaurant looking full) but it was a painful experience; we ordered multiple appetizer sized entrees among four people and they were brought out one at a time, with new plates and chop sticks after each dish. It was almost like they were treating this as a multi-course meal at a nice restaurant. Hopefully when they get busier they'll just bring all the food so you can eat it. We were starving and awkwardly eating small portions then waiting 15 minutes for the next dish. Dinner lasted at least an hour and a half.

If I had it to do over, I'd come here with a friend and sit at the bar, until they figure out the service. I hope they tweak the menu but that seems to be a disappointment that won't go away.

All this said, the options near here are so limited that I will likely be back, and hopefully have a better experience!
author: Robbie K.

description: I haven't felt inspired to write a 5-star review in a while but boy this place was good.  It was what I wish Mission Chinese would be - tastier, but without all the oil and greasiness and the attitude and the claustrophobic atmosphere.  Chubby Noodle is nicely laid out and though the timing of the dishes was a bit spotty, they're a new place so I'll cut em some slack.  Overall the service was attentive and friendly.  I am still daydreaming about the fried snapper and the mongolian lamb. I hate to give it 5 stars because I'll probably never get a table here again, but hey, they earned it.
author: Anthony L.

description: Great food, great service. Loved the salt & pepper prawns, halibut with shiitake mushrooms in a clay pot, spicy chicken wings, bok choy and kimchee. Only giving it 4 stars because it does have a distinct nightclub-like ambiance and seems to want to appeal to a young, late-night crowd. But that's just my personal thing - the food ROCKS and I would totally go back in heartbeat.
author: Cristina T.

description: Open in NYC. Please. Seriously. Open in NYC. Food is unbelievable. Spicy Garlic Noodles are amazing, as was every other dish on the menu. Good food, great music. Boom.
author: Jenny K.

description: Love this place! If you're in the marina and don't know what to eat, go to Chubby Noodle. The staff is honest and awesome and the food is honestly awesome!! FIVE STARS!!!!
author: Marissa R.

description: My favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco. The food so good, I can overlook the sometimes dull service. Garlic noodles, wings and duck tacos are all a must. They place really fun music, it's a good way to start a night out with friends. I've been wanting to try their brunch but haven't gotten around to it. It's a slight pain that they don't take reservations for smaller parties.
author: Ashley B.

description: Soft opening for Chubby Noodle Marina!  So far so good!  Eating dinner at this very moment, salivating over the menu... Cold tea is spicy and delicious.  Can't wait for the chicken noodle soup and meatball jook to arrive!
author: Kim K.

description: This place is awesome- food, music & service - 5 stars! This is the team behind Don Pistos, one of my favorite SF spots. They have figured out how to bring that energy to the Marina! My recommendation is the shrimp dish & a carafe of Pushback Sauvignon Blanc.
author: Callie B.

description: We went to Chubby Noodle last night for the first time.  I don't know if we happen to show up at just the right time, but had a great experience.  We were looking for some place open late, check.  Showed up just after 11pm on a Monday and were greeted at the door like it was any regular night and time.  Sat immediately.  The staff was very friendly and our server prompt and helpful.  He asked if we had been there before and if he could offer some suggestions.  Of course we said yes, and glad we did.  Everything was awesome.  Poke, Salmon sashimi, pork tacos, house made kimchi, and green beans.  I love trying different kimchi, and I have to say this was the best I have ever had.  They were not busy, with only one other table, but the service was lightning fast.  The pricing is very fair as well.  All that with beer and wine out the door for $100, including a better than 20% tip.  I hear they have an all inclusive Sunday brunch with all you can eat dim sum.  We are local and are planning to become regulars.
author: Alex R.

description: The best Asian fusion place that I have eaten at in a long time! We loved the service, Nick and his staff are just amazing to say the least!!!!!!! :)))) the food was absolutely delicious!!!!!! The restaurant itself and the ambiance is very comfortable, welcoming, and loved the music!!!!! They have their own Spotify channel and I'm totally subscribing! :) Bottom line - will go back for sure and tell all my friends!!!!! :))
author: Christina C.

description: A great new establishment on Lombard and Steiner.  Asian Cuisine, family style. I had Kung Pao wings and Spicy Garlic Noodles. The thing that sets this restaurant apart from most is their special attention to the consumer. They have very attentive and friendly staff members. Although the kitchen is exposed and the booths are in close proximity,  the restaurant is not hot at all.
author: Zulema U.

description: I have been to chubby noddle officially 5 times. Today was more fifth time and compared to the rest it was awful. The woman who was a server was terrible and had the worst attitude I've ever seen. Every time before ive had fun and friendly service. She messed up everything and give 0 effs about it. It would have been different if she cared and messed up but she really hated us. It was not the cubby noddle I know and if I go back again and get her as a server, then I'm leaving.
author: Sara M.

description: I've never felt so quickly at-home. The menu is small, but smartly selected. I'm a huge fan of the duck, and therefore recommend the chow fun. It has a nice kick without sacrificing flavor. While the dining is sophisticated, the atmosphere is super casual, warm, energetic and hip, even at midnight. Also, don't miss their signature sake, on tap.
author: Brittnie A.

description: We decided to check this place out after arriving in San Fransisco late at night. So glad we did. It's amazing. Small menu but they've perfected it. Great service as well. Awesome atmosphere for late night eats and some drinks.
author: Ashley R.

description: This place was great.  Had the All you can eat weekend brunch  dishes were solid vibes were good.  Brian the bartender is the man.  Definitely coming back.  My fav dishes were cold ramen, salt n pepper shrimp, and peking duck baos
author: Jay H.

description: We made a reservation at 7:30 and no one sat us till 9 o'clock but they remembered us the whole time and gave us free sake while we waited.... But After we finally got seated; the food came fast and the waiter was wonderful I couldn't have asked for a better time !!! Don't get the tea though it wasn't very good.
author: Jacob W.

description: I walked over a mile to get here and found out that they only have a $37 plus tax brunch on Sunday mornings from 10 to 3:30 PM there is no à la cart ordering at all. Won't be coming back. Pretty presumptuous to try to rope people into a huge drinking and eating escapade.
author: jon s.

description: Amazing new spot. Delicious food and super accommodating owner who cares about making this place a friendly neighborhood spot. Would definitely recommend for the prix fixe dim sum or a la carte dinner.
author: Michael A.

description: Amazing flavors.  Chow fun with duck was soo delicious.   Amazing selection of wines and sake on tap and what a fun atmosphere with hits from my high school days
author: Robert W.

description: Garlic noodles are the jam! I'm craving them right now as I type this. Definitely hit this place up, you won't be disappointed! FYI: It's a cash only situation so make sure you bring some.
author: Kate S.

description: was really looking forward to try this place in Marina but extremely disappointed by the arrogant waitress.  First, I think this place has a deal with hearing aid company because after you finished a meal, your ear drums would be blasted.  My ear drums are still vibrating after 15 minute leaving the restaurant.  We asked the waitress whether she could turn the music down a bit because we were quite uncomfortable.  She said that she was going to turn it down a notch but still blasting.  Then she offered to pack our food and sent us our way, basically, just get out if you don't like this loud music  The food was just ok, extremely salty and sweet.  With the noise and the waitress' attitude, this place is not worth losing my eardrums for   Beware, if you want to preserve your hearing, this is the place to avoid.
author: Yaw E.

description: i have had better much much much better (in SF and in Los Altos!) and not as pricey for chicken chow  main could of been so much better(like interesting veggies for example and no cheap crunchy "noodles" ..   for 12$ a small  bowl .. the  salad was Ok fair. pears were interesting.  but yeah plenty of other places around that are better ..the staff seemed like they were having a fun time ..  was nice they cleaned up after us..(thank you)  (i'm a slob one spoon for the pasta and salad.. (not 2) and the bathrooms didn't have towels (gross) (hot air dryers thou environmental, sort of.. it's gross ..
author: D.B B.

description: Oh my f ing god! My absolute fav place to eat of all all all time! I would eat here everyday if I could! Ridiculous! Bomb music, great service.. Omg omg omg
author: Anastasia P.

description: I was excited to try the new Chubby Noodle after having a few delicious meals at the Chubby Noodle in Amante Bar, and the new spot definitely delivered. There is a great selection of dishes and drinks without the menu being overwhelming. From what I remember of the Amante Chubby Noodle, the menu is pretty different but the same style food. It seems like it will be a great place to frequent with friends, awesome throwback music all night and the food is set up to eat family style. This was a loud restaurant on a Saturday night and I'm not sure its the same every night, but I would definitely recommend it for a night or with friends rather than a quite dinner. Everything we ordered was great but some of my favorites were the Chili Prawn Noodles (reminded me of Tom Ka Gai flavors), the Korean Pork Tacos (amazing tortillas!) and the Salt and Pepper Prawns (totally new twist on one of my favorite Chinese dishes). As far as drinks, it was a warm night so I opted for white wine, the bartender recommended the Pushback Sav Blanc, it was so good I stuck with that I didn't get a chance to try anything else!
author: Asia H.

description: This place has an amazing atmosphere and the food is absolutely delicious! The staff is amazing and very friendly! I live in the neighborhood and will definitely becoming a regular!
author: M Q.

description: The food is amazing. Tacos, tuna poke and ANY noodle will provide you with an insanely delicious meal. The music is great and service is excellent!!
author: Alexis L.

description: Never disappoints! Great vibe, music and eats. Been to this location and the one in North Beach several times and have never ordered something that wasn't 5 star worthy! Ribs and tacos are a must.
author: Jessica W.

description: This place is bomb.com! Walked in here on a whim! Brian, the Bartender is awesome! I had the pork ramen and I'm in love. My brother had the calamari and we were both so jealous of each other plates we did it family style. Pun intended! ;)
author: Dario F.

description: Awesome food, awesome vibe, and super friendly and fast service. Wish we lived in San Fran so we could come here all the time!!
author: Carrie A.

description: i would love to say its horrible so less people go but i LOVE IT and wish they had a bigger location!  the only issue I've had is that a couple of times our take-out/to-go portions have been noticeably smaller than the portions we get when we eat in. a little disappointing when you get home and open the boxes. other than that, i highly recommend it!
author: Ashley D.
